sentences.zh: 晉唐叔虞者，周武王子而成王弟。

translations.literal: Jin Tang Shu Yu was King Wu of Zhou's son and King Cheng's younger brother.
translations.idiomatic: Tang Shu Yu of Jin was a son of King Wu of Zhou and the younger brother of King Cheng.

sentences.zh: 初，武王與叔虞母會時，夢天謂武王曰：「余命女生子，名虞，余與之唐。」

translations.literal: Initially, Wu Wang with Shu Yu mother meet time, dreamed heaven told Wu Wang said: 'I command woman give birth son, name Yu, I give him Tang.'
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when King Wu met with Shu Yu's mother, he dreamed that heaven told King Wu: 'I command this woman to give birth to a son named Yu. I give him Tang.'

sentences.zh: 及生子，文在其手曰「虞」，故遂因命之曰虞。

translations.literal: And gave birth son, writing on his hand said 'Yu', therefore then followed named him Yu.
translations.idiomatic: When she gave birth to the son, there was writing on his hand that said 'Yu'. Therefore they followed this and named him Yu.

sentences.zh: 武王崩，成王立，唐有亂，周公誅滅唐。

translations.literal: King Wu died. King Cheng ascended. Tang had a rebellion. The Duke of Zhou executed and extinguished Tang.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu passed away. King Cheng ascended the throne. Tang rebelled. The Duke of Zhou executed the rebels and extinguished Tang.

sentences.zh: 成王與叔虞戲，削桐葉為珪以與叔虞，曰：「以此封若。」

translations.literal: Cheng Wang with Shu Yu played, carved paulownia leaf as gui to give Shu Yu, said: 'With this enfeoff you.'
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng played with Shu Yu. He carved a paulownia leaf into a gui tablet to give to Shu Yu, saying: 'With this I enfeoff you.'

sentences.zh: 史佚因請擇日立叔虞。

translations.literal: Shi Yi then requested to select a day to establish Shu Yu.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Yi then requested that an auspicious day be selected for establishing Shu Yu.

sentences.zh: 成王曰：「吾與之戲耳。」

translations.literal: Cheng Wang said: 'I with him played.'
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng said: 'I was just playing with him.'

sentences.zh: 史佚曰：「天子無戲言。

translations.literal: Shi Yi said: 'Tian zi no playing words.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Yi said: 'The tian zi has no playing words.

sentences.zh: 言則史書之，禮成之，樂歌之。」

translations.literal: Words then historians write them, rites complete them, music sings them.'
translations.idiomatic: Words then the historians write them, rites complete them, music sings them.'

sentences.zh: 於是遂封叔虞於唐。

translations.literal: They then enfeoffed Shu Yu at Tang.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Shu Yu was enfeoffed at Tang.

sentences.zh: 唐在河、汾之東，方百里，故曰唐叔虞。

translations.literal: Tang was east of the He and Fen rivers, a square of a hundred li. Therefore he was called Tang Shu Yu.
translations.idiomatic: Tang was located east of the Yellow River and Fen River, comprising a square area of one hundred li. Therefore he was called Tang Shu Yu.

sentences.zh: 姓姬氏，字子于。

translations.literal: His surname was the Ji clan. His courtesy name was Zi Yu.
translations.idiomatic: He bore the surname Ji. His courtesy name was Zi Yu.

sentences.zh: 唐叔子燮，是為晉侯。

translations.literal: Tang Shu's son Xie became the Jin Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Tang Shu's son Xie became the Marquis of Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉侯子寧族，是為武侯。

translations.literal: Jin Hou's son Ning Zu became Wu Hou.
translations.idiomatic: The Marquis of Jin's son Ning Zu became Marquis Wu.

sentences.zh: 武侯之子服人，是為成侯。

translations.literal: Wu Hou's son Fu Ren became Cheng Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Marquis Wu's son Fu Ren became Marquis Cheng.

sentences.zh: 成侯子福，是為厲侯。

translations.literal: Cheng Hou's son Fu became Li Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Marquis Cheng's son Fu became Marquis Li.

sentences.zh: 厲侯之子宜臼，是為靖侯。

translations.literal: Li Hou's son Yi Jiu became Jing Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Marquis Li's son Yi Jiu became Marquis Jing.

sentences.zh: 靖侯已來，年紀可推。

translations.literal: Since Jing Hou, the years can be traced.
translations.idiomatic: From Marquis Jing onward, the chronology can be reliably traced.

sentences.zh: 自唐叔至靖侯五世，無其年數。

translations.literal: From Tang Shu to Jing Hou were five generations, without their year numbers.
translations.idiomatic: From Tang Shu to Marquis Jing spanned five generations, but their exact years are not recorded.

sentences.zh: 靖侯十七年，周厲王迷惑暴虐，國人作亂，厲王出奔于彘，大臣行政，故曰「共和」。

translations.literal: Jing Hou seventeenth year, Zhou Li Wang bewildered tyrannical cruel, state people made rebellion, Li Wang fled to Zhi, ministers administered government, therefore called 'Gong He'.
translations.idiomatic: In Jing Hou's seventeenth year, King Li of Zhou was bewildered and tyrannically cruel. The state people made rebellion. King Li fled to Zhi. Ministers administered the government. Therefore it was called 'Gong He'.

sentences.zh: 十八年，靖侯卒，子釐侯司徒立。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Jing Hou died, and his son Xi Hou Si Tu ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Marquis Jing passed away, and his son Si Tu ascended as Marquis Xi.

sentences.zh: 釐侯十四年，周宣王初立。

translations.literal: In Xi Hou's fourteenth year, King Xuan of Zhou initially ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year of Marquis Xi's rule, King Xuan of Zhou ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 十八年，釐侯卒，子獻侯籍立。

translations.literal: In the eighteenth year, Xi Hou died, and his son Xian Hou Ji ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Marquis Xi passed away, and his son Ji ascended as Marquis Xian.

sentences.zh: 獻侯十一年卒，子穆侯費王立。

translations.literal: Xian Hou died in his eleventh year, and his son Mu Hou Fei Wang ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Marquis Xian died in his eleventh year of rule, and his son Fei Wang ascended as Marquis Mu.

sentences.zh: 穆侯四年，取齊女姜氏為夫人。

translations.literal: In Mu Hou's fourth year, he took a woman of the Jiang clan from Qi as his wife.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Marquis Mu's rule, he took a Jiang woman from Qi as his consort.

sentences.zh: 七年，伐條。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, he attacked Tiao.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, he attacked the state of Tiao.

sentences.zh: 生太子仇。

translations.literal: He gave birth to Crown Prince Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: She gave birth to the crown prince Qiu.

sentences.zh: 十年，伐千畝，有功。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, he attacked Qian Mu and had merit.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, he attacked Qian Mu and achieved victory.

sentences.zh: 生少子，名曰成師。

translations.literal: He gave birth to a young son named Cheng Shi.
translations.idiomatic: She gave birth to a younger son named Cheng Shi.

sentences.zh: 晉人師服曰：「異哉，君之命子也！

translations.literal: Jin person Shi Fu said: 'Strange, lord name son!'
translations.idiomatic: The Jin person Shi Fu said: 'Strange, how the lord names his sons!'

sentences.zh: 太子曰仇，仇者讎也。

translations.literal: The crown prince is called Qiu. Qiu means enemy.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince is named Qiu. Qiu means 'enemy' or 'adversary.'

sentences.zh: 少子曰成師，成師大號，成之者也。

translations.literal: The young son is called Cheng Shi. Cheng Shi is a great title—the one who will accomplish it.
translations.idiomatic: The younger son is named Cheng Shi. 'Cheng Shi' is an auspicious title—it means 'the one who will accomplish great things.'

sentences.zh: 名自命也；

translations.literal: Names self fate;
translations.idiomatic: Names are their own fate;

sentences.zh: 物自定也。

translations.literal: Things determine themselves.
translations.idiomatic: Things will determine themselves.

sentences.zh: 今適庶名反逆，此後晉其能毋亂乎？」

translations.literal: Now legitimate concubine names contrary perverse, after this Jin can not chaos?'
translations.idiomatic: Now the legitimate and concubine names are contrary and perverse. After this, can Jin not have chaos?'

sentences.zh: 二十七年，穆侯卒，弟殤叔自立，太子仇出奔。

translations.literal: In the twenty-seventh year, Mu Hou died. His younger brother Shang Shu self-established. Crown Prince Qiu fled.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, Marquis Mu passed away. His younger brother Shang Shu usurped the throne. Crown Prince Qiu fled into exile.

sentences.zh: 殤叔三年，周宣王崩。

translations.literal: In Shang Shu's third year, King Xuan of Zhou died.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year of Shang Shu's rule, King Xuan of Zhou passed away.

sentences.zh: 四年，穆侯太子仇率其徒襲殤叔而立，是為文侯。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Mu Hou's crown prince Qiu led his followers, attacked Shang Shu, and established himself, becoming Wen Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Crown Prince Qiu of Marquis Mu led his followers in an attack on Shang Shu, overthrew him, and established himself as ruler, becoming Marquis Wen.

sentences.zh: 文侯十年，周幽王無道，犬戎殺幽王，周東徙。

translations.literal: In Wen Hou's tenth year, King You of Zhou had no way. The Quan Rong killed King You. Zhou moved east.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year of Marquis Wen's rule, King You of Zhou ruled tyrannically. The Quanrong barbarians killed King You. The Zhou court moved eastward.

sentences.zh: 而秦襄公始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: And Qin Xiang Gong began to be ranked as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: And Qin Xiang Gong was first elevated to the rank of feudal lord.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，文侯仇卒，子昭侯伯立。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fifth year, Wen Hou Qiu died, and his son Zhao Hou Bo ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, Marquis Wen Qiu passed away, and his son Bo ascended as Marquis Zhao.

sentences.zh: 昭侯元年，封文侯弟成師于曲沃。

translations.literal: In Zhao Hou's first year, he enfeoffed Wen Hou's younger brother Cheng Shi at Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Marquis Zhao's rule, he enfeoffed his uncle Cheng Shi at Quwo.

sentences.zh: 曲沃邑大於翼。

translations.literal: The Qu Wo city was larger than Yi.
translations.idiomatic: The city of Quwo was larger than Yi.

sentences.zh: 翼，晉君都邑也。

translations.literal: Yi was the Jin lord's capital city.
translations.idiomatic: Yi was the Jin ruler's capital city.

sentences.zh: 成師封曲沃，號為桓叔。

translations.literal: Cheng Shi was enfeoffed at Qu Wo and styled Huan Shu.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Shi was enfeoffed at Quwo and given the title Uncle Huan.

sentences.zh: 靖侯庶孫欒賓相桓叔。

translations.literal: Jing Hou's concubine grandson Luan Bin assisted Huan Shu.
translations.idiomatic: Luan Bin, a grandson of Marquis Jing through a concubine, served as minister to Uncle Huan.

sentences.zh: 桓叔是時年五十八矣，好德，晉國之眾皆附焉。

translations.literal: Huan Shu at this time was fifty-eight years old, good at virtue. All the crowds of Jin state attached themselves to him.
translations.idiomatic: At this time Uncle Huan was fifty-eight years old and renowned for his virtue. All the people of Jin attached themselves to him.

sentences.zh: 君子曰：「晉之亂其在曲沃矣。

translations.literal: Gentleman said: 'Jin chaos perhaps at Qu Wo.'
translations.idiomatic: The gentleman said: 'Jin's chaos is perhaps at Qu Wo.'

sentences.zh: 末大於本而得民心，不亂何待！」

translations.literal: Branch larger than root and obtains people heart, not chaos what wait!'
translations.idiomatic: The branch is larger than the root and obtains the people's hearts. If not chaos, what does it wait for!'

sentences.zh: 七年，晉大臣潘父弒其君昭侯而迎曲沃桓叔。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Jin's minister Pan Fu assassinated his lord Zhao Hou and welcomed Qu Wo's Huan Shu.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, the Jin minister Pan Fu assassinated his ruler Marquis Zhao and welcomed Uncle Huan of Quwo.

sentences.zh: 桓叔欲入晉，晉人發兵攻桓叔。

translations.literal: Huan Shu desired to enter Jin. The Jin people sent troops to attack Huan Shu.
translations.idiomatic: Uncle Huan wished to enter the Jin capital. The Jin people dispatched troops to attack Uncle Huan.

sentences.zh: 桓叔敗，還歸曲沃。

translations.literal: Huan Shu was defeated and returned to Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: Uncle Huan was defeated and retreated back to Quwo.

sentences.zh: 晉人共立昭侯子平為君，是為孝侯。

translations.literal: The Jin people together established Zhao Hou's son Ping as lord, who became Xiao Hou.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin people united to install Ping, son of Marquis Zhao, as their ruler, who became Marquis Xiao.

sentences.zh: 誅潘父。

translations.literal: They executed Pan Fu.
translations.idiomatic: They executed Pan Fu.

sentences.zh: 孝侯八年，曲沃桓叔卒，子胛桓叔，是為曲沃莊伯。

translations.literal: In Xiao Hou's eighth year, Qu Wo's Huan Shu died. His son Jia became Huan Shu, who was Qu Wo Zhuang Bo.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year of Marquis Xiao's rule, Uncle Huan of Quwo passed away. His son Jia succeeded him as Uncle Huan and became known as Zhuang Bo of Quwo.

sentences.zh: 孝侯十五年，曲沃莊伯弒其君晉孝侯于翼。

translations.literal: In Xiao Hou's fifteenth year, Qu Wo Zhuang Bo assassinated his lord Jin Xiao Hou at Yi.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year of Marquis Xiao's rule, Zhuang Bo of Quwo assassinated his lord Marquis Xiao of Jin at Yi.

sentences.zh: 晉人攻曲沃莊伯，莊伯復入曲沃。

translations.literal: The Jin people attacked Qu Wo Zhuang Bo. Zhuang Bo again entered Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin people attacked Zhuang Bo of Quwo. Zhuang Bo retreated back into Quwo.

sentences.zh: 晉人復立孝侯子郄為君，是為鄂侯。

translations.literal: The Jin people again established Xiao Hou's son Xi as lord, who became E Hou.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin people once again installed Xi, son of Marquis Xiao, as their ruler, who became Marquis E.

sentences.zh: 鄂侯六年卒。

translations.literal: E Hou died in his sixth year.
translations.idiomatic: Marquis E died in his sixth year of rule.

sentences.zh: 曲沃莊伯聞晉鄂侯卒，乃興兵伐晉。

translations.literal: Qu Wo Zhuang Bo heard that Jin E Hou died, then raised troops to attack Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Bo of Quwo heard that Marquis E of Jin had died, so he raised troops to attack Jin.

sentences.zh: 周平王使虢公將兵伐曲沃莊伯，莊伯走保曲沃。

translations.literal: Zhou Ping Wang made Guo Gong lead troops to attack Qu Wo Zhuang Bo. Zhuang Bo fled to defend Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: King Ping of Zhou ordered Duke Guo to lead troops against Zhuang Bo of Quwo. Zhuang Bo fled back to defend Quwo.

sentences.zh: 晉人共立鄂侯子光，是為哀侯。

translations.literal: The Jin people together established E Hou's son Guang, who became Ai Hou.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin people united to install Guang, son of Marquis E, as their ruler, who became Marquis Ai.

sentences.zh: 哀侯二年曲沃莊伯卒，子稱代莊伯立，是為曲沃武公。

translations.literal: In Ai Hou's second year, Qu Wo Zhuang Bo died. His son Cheng replaced Zhuang Bo and ascended, becoming Qu Wo Wu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year of Marquis Ai's rule, Zhuang Bo of Quwo died. His son Cheng succeeded him and became known as Wu Gong of Quwo.

sentences.zh: 哀侯六年，魯弒其君隱公。

translations.literal: In Ai Hou's sixth year, Lu assassinated their lord Duke Yin.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year of Marquis Ai's rule, Lu assassinated their ruler Duke Yin.

sentences.zh: 哀侯八年，晉侵陘廷。

translations.literal: In Ai Hou's eighth year, Jin invaded Xing Ting.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year of Marquis Ai's rule, Jin invaded Xing Ting.

sentences.zh: 陘廷與曲沃武公謀，九年，伐晉于汾旁，虜哀侯。

translations.literal: Xing Ting plotted with Qu Wo Wu Gong. In the ninth year, they attacked Jin by the Fen River and captured Ai Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Xing Ting conspired with Wu Gong of Quwo. In the ninth year, they attacked Jin along the Fen River and captured Marquis Ai.

sentences.zh: 晉人乃立哀侯子小子為君，是為小子侯。

translations.literal: The Jin people then established Ai Hou's son Xiao Zi as lord, who became Xiao Zi Hou.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin people then installed Xiao Zi, son of Marquis Ai, as their ruler, who became known as Lord Xiao Zi.

sentences.zh: 小子元年，曲沃武公使韓萬殺所虜晉哀侯。

translations.literal: In Xiao Zi's first year, Qu Wo Wu Gong made Han Wan kill the captured Jin Ai Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Lord Xiao Zi's rule, Wu Gong of Quwo ordered Han Wan to kill the captive Marquis Ai of Jin.

sentences.zh: 曲沃益彊，晉無如之何。

translations.literal: Qu Wo became increasingly strong. Jin had no way to deal with it.
translations.idiomatic: Quwo grew increasingly powerful. Jin had no means to counter it.

sentences.zh: 晉小子之四年，曲沃武公誘召晉小子殺之。

translations.literal: In Jin Xiao Zi's fourth year, Qu Wo Wu Gong lured and summoned Jin Xiao Zi and killed him.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Lord Xiao Zi's rule, Wu Gong of Quwo lured him with a summons and assassinated him.

sentences.zh: 周桓王使虢仲伐曲沃武公，武公入于曲沃，乃立晉哀侯弟緡為晉侯。

translations.literal: Zhou Huan Wang made Guo Zhong attack Qu Wo Wu Gong. Wu Gong entered Qu Wo. They then established Jin Ai Hou's younger brother Min as Jin Hou.
translations.idiomatic: King Huan of Zhou ordered Guo Zhong to attack Wu Gong of Quwo. Wu Gong retreated into Quwo. They then installed Min, younger brother of Marquis Ai, as the Jin ruler.

sentences.zh: 晉侯緡四年，宋執鄭祭仲而立突為鄭君。

translations.literal: In Jin Hou Min's fourth year, Song seized Zheng's Ji Zhong and established Tu as Zheng's lord.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year of Duke Min of Jin's rule, Song seized Ji Zhong of Zheng and installed Tu as the ruler of Zheng.

sentences.zh: 晉侯十九年，齊人管至父弒其君襄公。

translations.literal: In Jin Hou's nineteenth year, Qi's Guan Zhi Fu assassinated their lord Duke Xiang.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year of Duke Min of Jin's rule, Guan Zhi Fu of Qi assassinated his ruler Duke Xiang.

sentences.zh: 晉侯二十八年，齊桓公始霸。

translations.literal: In Jin Hou's twenty-eighth year, Qi's Duke Huan began his hegemony.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year of Duke Min of Jin's rule, Duke Huan of Qi began his era of hegemony.

sentences.zh: 曲沃武公伐晉侯緡，滅之，盡以其寶器賂獻于周釐王。

translations.literal: Qu Wo Wu Gong attacked Jin Hou Min and extinguished him. He completely bribed and presented his precious vessels to Zhou Xi Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Gong of Quwo attacked Duke Min of Jin and destroyed him. He completely bribed King Xi of Zhou with precious vessels.

sentences.zh: 釐王命曲沃武公為晉君，列為諸侯，於是盡併晉地而有之。

translations.literal: Xi Wang commanded Qu Wo Wu Gong to be Jin's lord, ranked as feudal lords. Then he completely annexed Jin's territory and possessed it.
translations.idiomatic: King Xi commanded Wu Gong of Quwo to become the ruler of Jin, granting him the rank of feudal lord. Thus he completely annexed all Jin territory and took possession of it.

sentences.zh: 曲沃武公已即位三十七年矣，更號曰晉武公。

translations.literal: Qu Wo Wu Gong had already ascended for thirty-seven years. He changed his title to Jin Wu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Gong of Quwo had already been on the throne for thirty-seven years. He changed his title to Duke Wu of Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉武公始都晉國，前即位曲沃，通年三十八年。

translations.literal: Jin Wu Gong began to make his capital in the Jin state. Before ascending, he was at Qu Wo. Total years were thirty-eight.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wu of Jin first established his capital in the Jin state. Before his ascension, he had been at Quwo. In total, he ruled for thirty-eight years.

sentences.zh: 武公稱者，先晉穆侯曾孫也，曲沃桓叔孫也。

translations.literal: The one called Wu Gong was the former Jin Mu Hou's great-grandson, and Qu Wo Huan Shu's grandson.
translations.idiomatic: This Duke Wu was a great-grandson of the former Marquis Mu of Jin, and a grandson of Uncle Huan of Quwo.

sentences.zh: 桓叔者，始封曲沃。

translations.literal: Huan Shu was the one who began to be enfeoffed at Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: Uncle Huan was the first to be enfeoffed at Quwo.

sentences.zh: 武公，莊伯子也。

translations.literal: Wu Gong was Zhuang Bo's son.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wu was the son of Zhuang Bo.

sentences.zh: 自桓叔初封曲沃以至武公滅晉也，凡六十七歲，而卒代晉為諸侯。

translations.literal: From Huan Shu's initial enfeoffment at Qu Wo until Wu Gong extinguished Jin, altogether sixty-seven years, and he finally replaced Jin as feudal lord.
translations.idiomatic: From Uncle Huan's initial enfeoffment at Quwo until Duke Wu conquered Jin, it took altogether sixty-seven years, and he finally replaced Jin as a feudal lord.

sentences.zh: 武公代晉二歲，卒。

translations.literal: Wu Gong replaced Jin for two years, then died.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wu ruled over the unified Jin for two years, then died.

sentences.zh: 與曲沃通年，即位凡三十九年而卒。

translations.literal: With Qu Wo total years, he ascended for altogether thirty-nine years and died.
translations.idiomatic: Including his years at Quwo, he was on the throne for a total of thirty-nine years when he died.

sentences.zh: 子獻公詭諸立。

translations.literal: His son Duke Xian Gui Zhu ascended.
translations.idiomatic: His son Gui Zhu ascended as Duke Xian.

sentences.zh: 獻公元年，周惠王弟穨攻惠王，惠王出奔，居鄭之櫟邑。

translations.literal: In Duke Xian's first year, Zhou Hui Wang's younger brother Sui attacked Hui Wang. Hui Wang fled and resided in Zheng's Li Yi.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Duke Xian's rule, King Hui of Zhou's younger brother Sui attacked the king. King Hui fled and took refuge in the Li settlement of Zheng.

sentences.zh: 五年，伐驪戎，得驪姬、驪姬弟，俱愛幸之。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, he attacked the Li Rong and obtained Li Ji and Li Ji's younger brother. He loved and favored them both.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, he attacked the Lirong barbarians and captured Li Ji along with her younger brother. He loved and favored them both.

sentences.zh: 八年，士蒍說公曰：「故晉之群公子多，不誅，亂且起。」

translations.literal: Eighth year, Shi Wei persuaded gong said: 'Former Jin group princes many, not execute, chaos about to rise.'
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Shi Wei persuaded the gong, saying: 'Formerly Jin's group of princes are many. If not executed, chaos is about to rise.'

sentences.zh: 乃使盡殺諸公子，而城聚都之，命曰絳，始都絳。

translations.literal: He then made them completely kill the various princes, walled and gathered them as capital, named it Jiang, and began to make Jiang the capital.
translations.idiomatic: He then ordered the complete slaughter of all the princes, fortified the city as his capital, named it Jiang, and established Jiang as his capital city.

sentences.zh: 九年，晉群公子既亡奔虢，虢以其故再伐晉，弗克。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Jin's group of princes had already fled to Guo. Guo because of this reason again attacked Jin but did not conquer.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Jin's princes had already fled to Guo. Guo, taking advantage of this situation, attacked Jin again but failed to conquer it.

sentences.zh: 十年，晉欲伐虢，士蒍曰：「且待其亂。」

translations.literal: Tenth year, Jin desired attack Guo, Shi Wei said: 'Moreover wait their chaos.'
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Jin desired to attack Guo. Shi Wei said: 'Moreover wait for their chaos.'

sentences.zh: 十二年，驪姬生奚齊。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Li Ji gave birth to Xi Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Li Ji gave birth to Xi Qi.

sentences.zh: 獻公有意廢太子，乃曰：「曲沃吾先祖宗廟所在，而蒲邊秦，屈邊翟，不使諸子居之，我懼焉。」

translations.literal: Xian Gong had intention to depose crown prince, then said: 'Qu Wo my first ancestor ancestral temple located, and Pu borders Qin, Qu borders Di, not make various sons reside there, I fear it.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian had the intention to depose the crown prince. He then said: 'Qu Wo is where my first ancestor's ancestral temple is located. Pu borders Qin, Qu borders the Di. If I do not make the various sons reside there, I fear it.'

sentences.zh: 於是使太子申生居曲沃，公子重耳居蒲，公子夷吾居屈。

translations.literal: He then made Crown Prince Shen Sheng reside at Qu Wo, Prince Chong Er reside at Pu, and Prince Yi Wu reside at Qu.
translations.idiomatic: He then stationed Crown Prince Shen Sheng at Quwo, Prince Chong Er at Pu, and Prince Yi Wu at Qu.

sentences.zh: 獻公與驪姬子奚齊居絳。

translations.literal: Duke Xian resided at Jiang with Li Ji's son Xi Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian resided at Jiang along with Li Ji's son Xi Qi.

sentences.zh: 晉國以此知太子不立也。

translations.literal: Jin's state with this knew the crown prince would not be established.
translations.idiomatic: The state of Jin understood from this that the crown prince would not be established.

sentences.zh: 太子申生，其母齊桓公女也，曰齊姜，早死。

translations.literal: Crown Prince Shen Sheng—his mother was Qi Huan Gong's daughter, called Qi Jiang. She died early.
translations.idiomatic: Crown Prince Shen Sheng's mother was a daughter of Duke Huan of Qi, known as Qi Jiang. She died young.

sentences.zh: 申生同母女弟為秦穆公夫人。

translations.literal: Shen Sheng's same mother younger sister became Qin Mu Gong's wife.
translations.idiomatic: Shen Sheng's full younger sister became the consort of Duke Mu of Qin.

sentences.zh: 重耳母，翟之狐氏女也。

translations.literal: Chong Er's mother was a woman of the Hu clan from the Di.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er's mother was a woman from the Hu clan of the Di people.

sentences.zh: 夷吾母，重耳母女弟也。

translations.literal: Yi Wu's mother was Chong Er's mother's younger sister.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Wu's mother was the younger sister of Chong Er's mother.

sentences.zh: 獻公子八人，而太子申生、重耳、夷吾皆有賢行。

translations.literal: Duke Xian had eight princes, and Crown Prince Shen Sheng, Chong Er, and Yi Wu all had worthy conduct.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian had eight sons, and Crown Prince Shen Sheng, Chong Er, and Yi Wu all displayed virtuous conduct.

sentences.zh: 及得驪姬，乃遠此三子。

translations.literal: When he obtained Li Ji, he then distanced these three sons.
translations.idiomatic: After obtaining Li Ji, he began to distance himself from these three sons.

sentences.zh: 十六年，晉獻公作二軍。

translations.literal: In the sixteenth year, Jin's Duke Xian made two armies.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Duke Xian of Jin organized two armies.

sentences.zh: 公將上軍，太子申生將下軍，趙夙御戎，畢萬為右，伐滅霍，滅魏，滅耿。

translations.literal: The gong led the upper army. Crown Prince Shen Sheng led the lower army. Zhao Su drove the chariot. Bi Wan was on the right. They attacked and extinguished Huo, extinguished Wei, extinguished Geng.
translations.idiomatic: The duke commanded the upper army. Crown Prince Shen Sheng commanded the lower army. Zhao Su drove the chariot. Bi Wan stood on the right. They attacked and destroyed Huo, destroyed Wei, and destroyed Geng.

sentences.zh: 還，為太子城曲沃，賜趙夙耿，賜畢萬魏，以為大夫。

translations.literal: Upon returning, for the crown prince he walled Qu Wo. He granted Zhao Su Geng, granted Bi Wan Wei, to be grand officers.
translations.idiomatic: Upon returning, he fortified Quwo for the crown prince. He granted Geng to Zhao Su and Wei to Bi Wan, appointing them as grand officers.

sentences.zh: 士蒍曰：「太子不得立矣。

translations.literal: Shi Wei said: 'Crown prince not able established.'
translations.idiomatic: Shi Wei said: 'The crown prince will not be able to be established.'

sentences.zh: 分之都城，而位以卿，先為之極，又安得立！

translations.literal: Divided him capital city, and positioned with qing, first made him pole, again how obtain establish!'
translations.idiomatic: He divided him a capital city, and positioned him with qing rank. He first made him the pole. How again can he be established!'

sentences.zh: 不如逃之，無使罪至。

translations.literal: It would be better to flee it. Do not let crime arrive.
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to flee. Do not let guilt befall you.

sentences.zh: 為吳太伯，不亦可乎，猶有令名。」

translations.literal: Be Wu Tai Bo, not also permissible, still have good name.'
translations.idiomatic: To be like Wu Tai Bo—isn't that also permissible? You would still have a good name.'

sentences.zh: 太子不從。

translations.literal: The crown prince did not follow.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince refused to comply.

sentences.zh: 卜偃曰：「畢萬之後必大。

translations.literal: Bu Yan said: 'Bi Wan descendants must great.
translations.idiomatic: Bu Yan said: 'Bi Wan's descendants must be great.

sentences.zh: 萬，盈數也；

translations.literal: Wan, full number;
translations.idiomatic: Wan is a full number;

sentences.zh: 魏，大名也。

translations.literal: Wei is a great name.
translations.idiomatic: Wei is an auspicious name.

sentences.zh: 以是始賞，天開之矣。

translations.literal: Beginning the reward with this—heaven opened it.
translations.idiomatic: Beginning the rewards with this—heaven has blessed it.

sentences.zh: 天子曰兆民，諸侯曰萬民，今命之大，以從盈數，其必有眾。」

translations.literal: Tian zi called myriad people, feudal lords called ten thousand people, now name it great, to follow full number, it must have multitude.'
translations.idiomatic: The tian zi is called myriad people, feudal lords are called ten thousand people. Now naming it great to follow the full number—it must have a multitude.'

sentences.zh: 初，畢萬卜仕於晉國，遇屯之比。

translations.literal: Initially, Bi Wan divined about serving in Jin state and encountered Tun of Bi.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when Bi Wan divined about taking office in Jin, he received the hexagram Tun transforming into Bi.

sentences.zh: 辛廖占之曰：「吉。

translations.literal: Xin Liao divined it said: 'Auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: Xin Liao divined it and said: 'Auspicious.

sentences.zh: 屯固比入，吉孰大焉。

translations.literal: Tun is solid, Bi enters. What auspiciousness is greater than this?
translations.idiomatic: Tun is firm, and Bi enters. What greater auspiciousness could there be?

sentences.zh: 其後必蕃昌。」

translations.literal: Its descendants must flourish prosperous.'
translations.idiomatic: His descendants must flourish and prosper.'

sentences.zh: 十七年，晉侯使太子申生伐東山。

translations.literal: In the seventeenth year, the Jin Hou made Crown Prince Shen Sheng attack Dong Shan.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Duke Xian of Jin sent Crown Prince Shen Sheng to attack Dongshan.

sentences.zh: 裏克諫獻公曰：「太子奉冢祀社稷之粢盛，以朝夕視君膳者也，故曰冢子。

translations.literal: Li Ke admonished Xian Gong said: 'Crown prince offers ancestral sacrifices state altars millet offerings, with morning evening oversees lord meals, therefore called eldest son.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke admonished Duke Xian, saying: 'The crown prince offers the ancestral sacrifices and the state's millet offerings to the altars. He oversees the lord's meals morning and evening. Therefore he is called the eldest son.

sentences.zh: 君行則守，有守則從，從曰撫軍，守曰監國，古之制也。

translations.literal: When the lord goes, then there is a guard. Having a guard, then there is following. Following is called soothing the army. Guarding is called overseeing the state. This is the ancient system.
translations.idiomatic: When the ruler goes on campaign, a regent remains behind. With a regent, there is also a deputy. The deputy soothes the army. The regent oversees the state. This is the ancient system.

sentences.zh: 夫率師，專行謀也；

translations.literal: Leading troops, monopolizing action planning;
translations.idiomatic: Leading troops is monopolizing action and planning;

sentences.zh: 誓軍旅，君與國政之所圖也：非太子之事也。

translations.literal: Oathing armies, lord and state governance what plotted: not crown prince matter.
translations.idiomatic: Oathing the armies—what the lord and state governance plotted: it is not the crown prince's matter.

sentences.zh: 師在制命而已，稟命則不威，專命則不孝，故君之嗣適不可以帥師。

translations.literal: The troops are in controlling commands only. Receiving commands then not awe-inspiring. Monopolizing commands then not filial. Therefore the lord's proper heir cannot lead troops.
translations.idiomatic: The army exists only to execute commands. If receiving orders, it lacks authority. If monopolizing commands, it lacks filial piety. Therefore the ruler's legitimate heir cannot command troops.

sentences.zh: 君失其官，率師不威，將安用之？」

translations.literal: Lord loses his office, leads troops not awe-inspiring, how use it?'
translations.idiomatic: The lord loses his office. Leading troops is not awe-inspiring. How can it be used?'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「寡人有子，未知其太子誰立。」

translations.literal: Gong said: 'I have sons, not know their crown prince who establish.'
translations.idiomatic: The gong said: 'I have sons. I do not know which crown prince to establish.'

sentences.zh: 裏克不對而退，見太子。

translations.literal: Li Ke did not reply and retreated. He saw the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke made no response and withdrew. He went to see the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 太子曰：「吾其廢乎？」

translations.literal: Crown prince said: 'I perhaps deposed?'
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince said: 'Will I perhaps be deposed?'

sentences.zh: 裏克曰：「太子勉之！

translations.literal: Li Ke said: 'Crown prince strive!'
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke said: 'Crown prince, strive!'

sentences.zh: 教以軍旅，不共是懼，何故廢乎？

translations.literal: Taught with armies, not share this fear, why deposed?
translations.idiomatic: He was taught with armies. He does not share this fear. Why would he be deposed?

sentences.zh: 且子懼不孝，毋懼不得立。

translations.literal: Moreover, fear not being filial. Do not fear not being established.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, fear only being unfilial. Do not fear failing to be established as heir.

sentences.zh: 修己而不責人，則免於難。」

translations.literal: Cultivate self and not blame others, then avoid calamity.'
translations.idiomatic: Cultivate yourself and do not blame others, then you will avoid calamity.'

sentences.zh: 太子帥師，公衣之偏衣，佩之金玦。

translations.literal: The crown prince led troops. The gong clothed him in a one-sided robe and belted him with a gold jue.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince commanded the troops. The duke clothed him in a mourning robe and girded him with a gold jue pendant.

sentences.zh: 裏克謝病，不從太子。

translations.literal: Li Ke declined with illness. He did not follow the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke pleaded illness and refused to accompany the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 太子遂伐東山。

translations.literal: The crown prince then attacked Dong Shan.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince then proceeded to attack Dongshan.

sentences.zh: 十九年，獻公曰：「始吾先君莊伯、武公之誅晉亂，而虢常助晉伐我，又匿晉亡公子，果為亂。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, Xian Gong said: 'Beginning my first lords Zhuang Bo, Wu Gong executed Jin chaos, and Guo often helped Jin attacked me, again hid Jin fled princes, indeed made rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Duke Xian said: 'From the beginning, my first lords Zhuang Bo and Wu Gong executed Jin's chaos, and Guo often helped Jin attack me. They again hid Jin's fled princes. Indeed they made rebellion.

sentences.zh: 弗誅，後遺子孫憂。」

translations.literal: Not execute, later leave descendants worry.'
translations.idiomatic: If not executed, later will leave descendants worry.'

sentences.zh: 乃使荀息以屈產之乘假道於虞。

translations.literal: He then made Xun Xi with Qu Chan's horses request passage through Yu.
translations.idiomatic: He then sent Xun Xi with Qu Chan's chariot team to request passage through Yu.

sentences.zh: 虞假道，遂伐虢，取其下陽以歸。

translations.literal: Yu granted passage. He then attacked Guo, took its Xia Yang and returned.
translations.idiomatic: Yu granted passage through its territory. He then attacked Guo, captured its Xiayang, and returned home.

sentences.zh: 獻公私謂驪姬曰：「吾欲廢太子，以奚齊代之。」

translations.literal: Xian Gong privately told Li Ji said: 'I desire depose crown prince, with Xi Qi replace him.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian privately told Li Ji: 'I desire to depose the crown prince and replace him with Xi Qi.'

sentences.zh: 驪姬泣曰：「太子之立，諸侯皆已知之，而數將兵，百姓附之，柰何以賤妾之故廢適立庶？

translations.literal: Li Ji wept said: 'Crown prince establishment, feudal lords all already know it, and frequently led troops, common people attached to him, how with lowly concubine reason depose proper establish concubine?
translations.idiomatic: Li Ji wept and said: 'The crown prince's establishment—all the feudal lords already know it. He frequently led troops. The common people are attached to him. How can you, for the sake of a lowly concubine, depose the proper heir and establish the concubine?

sentences.zh: 君必行之，妾自殺也。」

translations.literal: Lord must do it, concubine suicide.'
translations.idiomatic: If the lord must do it, the concubine will suicide.'

sentences.zh: 驪姬詳譽太子，而陰令人譖惡太子，而欲立其子。

translations.literal: Li Ji pretended to praise the crown prince, but secretly made people slander and harm the crown prince, desiring to establish her own son.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ji pretended to praise the crown prince, but secretly had people slander him and plot against him, all while scheming to establish her own son as heir.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，驪姬謂太子曰：「君夢見齊姜，太子速祭曲沃，歸釐於君。」

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, Li Ji told crown prince said: 'Lord dreamed saw Qi Jiang, crown prince quickly sacrifice Qu Wo, return blessing to lord.'
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, Li Ji told the crown prince: 'The lord dreamed he saw Qi Jiang. Crown prince, quickly sacrifice at Qu Wo and return the blessing to the lord.'

sentences.zh: 太子於是祭其母齊姜於曲沃，上其薦胙於獻公。

translations.literal: The crown prince then sacrificed to his mother Qi Jiang at Qu Wo and presented the sacrificial meat to Duke Xian.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince then performed sacrifices to his mother Qi Jiang at Quwo and presented the sacrificial meat to Duke Xian.

sentences.zh: 獻公時出獵，置胙於宮中。

translations.literal: Duke Xian at the time went hunting and placed the meat in the palace.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian had gone hunting at the time and left the sacrificial meat in the palace.

sentences.zh: 驪姬使人置毒藥胙中。

translations.literal: Li Ji made people place poison in the meat.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ji had her agents place poison in the sacrificial meat.

sentences.zh: 居二日，獻公從獵來還，宰人上胙獻公，獻公欲饗之。

translations.literal: He stayed two days. Duke Xian came back from hunting. The cook presented the meat to Duke Xian. Duke Xian desired to taste it.
translations.idiomatic: Two days later, Duke Xian returned from hunting. The cook presented the sacrificial meat to him. Duke Xian wanted to taste it.

sentences.zh: 驪姬從旁止之，曰：「胙所從來遠，宜試之。」

translations.literal: Li Ji from side stopped him, said: 'Meat where from come far, should test it.'
translations.idiomatic: Li Ji stopped him from the side, saying: 'The meat comes from far away. You should test it.'

sentences.zh: 祭地，地墳；

translations.literal: Sacrificed earth, earth rose;
translations.idiomatic: He sacrificed to the earth, and the earth rose up;

sentences.zh: 與犬，犬死；

translations.literal: Gave to dog, dog died;
translations.idiomatic: He gave it to a dog, and the dog died;

sentences.zh: 與小臣，小臣死。

translations.literal: He gave it to a small minister, and the small minister died.
translations.idiomatic: He gave some to a junior official, who died after eating it.

sentences.zh: 驪姬泣曰：「太子何忍也！

translations.literal: Li Ji wept said: 'Crown prince how cruel!
translations.idiomatic: Li Ji wept and said: 'How cruel the crown prince is!

sentences.zh: 其父而欲弒代之，況他人乎？

translations.literal: His father and desires assassinate replace him, moreover others?
translations.idiomatic: He desires to assassinate and replace even his own father. What about others?

sentences.zh: 且君老矣，旦暮之人，曾不能待而欲弒之！」

translations.literal: Moreover lord old, morning evening person, once cannot wait and desires assassinate him!'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, the lord is old, a person of morning and evening. He once cannot wait and desires to assassinate him!'

sentences.zh: 謂獻公曰：「太子所以然者，不過以妾及奚齊之故。

translations.literal: Told Xian Gong said: 'Crown prince so do, not more than because concubine and Xi Qi reason.
translations.idiomatic: She told Duke Xian: 'The reason the crown prince does this is nothing more than because of me and Xi Qi.

sentences.zh: 妾願子母辟之他國，若早自殺，毋徒使母子為太子所魚肉也。

translations.literal: I wish mother and son would avoid to another state. If we suicide early, we won't vainly let mother and son be butchered by the crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: I wish you mother and son would flee to another state. If we commit suicide early, we won't be letting mother and son be butchered by the crown prince for nothing.

sentences.zh: 始君欲廢之，妾猶恨之；

translations.literal: Beginning lord desired depose him, concubine still resented it;
translations.idiomatic: At the beginning when the lord desired to depose him, I still resented it;

sentences.zh: 至於今，妾殊自失於此。」

translations.literal: Until now, concubine especially self lost at this.'
translations.idiomatic: Until now, I especially feel I have lost myself in this.'

sentences.zh: 太子聞之，奔新城。

translations.literal: The crown prince heard of it and fled to Xin Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince heard about this and fled to Xincheng.

sentences.zh: 獻公怒，乃誅其傅杜原款。

translations.literal: Duke Xian was angered and then executed his tutor Du Yuan Kuan.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian was furious and had his tutor Du Yuankuan executed.

sentences.zh: 或謂太子曰：「為此藥者乃驪姬也，太子何不自辭明之？」

translations.literal: Someone told crown prince said: 'Made this medicine was Li Ji, crown prince why not self explain clarify it?'
translations.idiomatic: Someone told the crown prince: 'The one who made this medicine was Li Ji. Why doesn't the crown prince explain and clarify it himself?'

sentences.zh: 太子曰：「吾君老矣，非驪姬，寢不安，食不甘。

translations.literal: Crown prince said: 'My lord old, without Li Ji, sleep not peaceful, eat not sweet.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince said: 'My lord is old. Without Li Ji, his sleep is not peaceful, his eating is not sweet.

sentences.zh: 即辭之，君且怒之。

translations.literal: If I explain it, the lord will be angry about it.
translations.idiomatic: If I explain this, the duke will be angry about it.

sentences.zh: 不可。」

translations.literal: Not permissible.'
translations.idiomatic: It cannot be done.'

sentences.zh: 或謂太子曰：「可奔他國。」

translations.literal: Someone told crown prince said: 'Can flee other state.'
translations.idiomatic: Someone told the crown prince: 'You can flee to another state.'

sentences.zh: 太子曰：「被此惡名以出，人誰內我？

translations.literal: Crown prince said: 'Carry this evil name to leave, people who accept me?
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince said: 'To leave carrying this evil name—who among people would accept me?

sentences.zh: 我自殺耳。」

translations.literal: I suicide.'
translations.idiomatic: I will commit suicide.'

sentences.zh: 十二月戊申，申生自殺於新城。

translations.literal: In the twelfth month, Wu Shen, Shen Sheng committed suicide at Xin Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, on the day Wu Shen, Shen Sheng committed suicide at Xincheng.

sentences.zh: 此時重耳、夷吾來朝。

translations.literal: At this time, Chong Er and Yi Wu came to court.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Chong Er and Yi Wu came to pay court to their father.

sentences.zh: 人或告驪姬曰：「二公子怨驪姬譖殺太子。」

translations.literal: Someone told Li Ji said: 'Two princes resent Li Ji slandered killed crown prince.'
translations.idiomatic: Someone told Li Ji: 'The two princes resent that Li Ji slandered and killed the crown prince.'

sentences.zh: 驪姬恐，因譖二公子：「申生之藥胙，二公子知之。」

translations.literal: Li Ji feared, therefore slandered two princes: 'Shen Sheng medicine meat, two princes knew it.'
translations.idiomatic: Li Ji feared, and therefore slandered the two princes: 'The two princes knew about Shen Sheng's poisoned meat.'

sentences.zh: 二子聞之，恐，重耳走蒲，夷吾走屈，保其城，自備守。

translations.literal: The two sons heard of it and feared. Chong Er fled to Pu, Yi Wu fled to Qu, protecting their cities and preparing their own defenses.
translations.idiomatic: The two brothers heard about it and became fearful. Chong Er fled to Pu, Yi Wu fled to Qu, each defending their cities and preparing for their own protection.

sentences.zh: 初，獻公使士蒍為二公子筑蒲、屈城，弗就。

translations.literal: Initially, Duke Xian made Shi Wei build cities for the two princes at Pu and Qu, but he did not complete them.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Duke Xian had Shi Wei build fortified cities for his two sons at Pu and Qu, but Shi Wei did not complete the work.

sentences.zh: 夷吾以告公，公怒士蒍。

translations.literal: Yi Wu told the gong about it, and the gong was angered at Shi Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Wu reported this to his father, who became angry with Shi Wei.

sentences.zh: 士蒍謝曰：「邊城少寇，安用之？」

translations.literal: Shi Wei apologized said: 'Border cities few bandits, why use them?'
translations.idiomatic: Shi Wei apologized and said: 'Border cities have few bandits. Why use them?'

sentences.zh: 退而歌曰：「狐裘蒙茸，一國三公，吾誰適從！」

translations.literal: Retreated and sang said: 'Fox fur robe bushy, one state three gong, I who follow!'
translations.idiomatic: He retreated and sang: 'Fox fur robe bushy, one state three gong—who should I follow!'

sentences.zh: 卒就城。

translations.literal: He finally completed the cities.
translations.idiomatic: Shi Wei finally completed the fortifications.

sentences.zh: 及申生死，二子亦歸保其城。

translations.literal: When Shen Sheng died, the two sons also returned and protected their cities.
translations.idiomatic: When Shen Sheng died, the two brothers also returned to their fortified cities to defend them.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，獻公怒二子不辭而去，果有謀矣，乃使兵伐蒲。

translations.literal: In the twenty-second year, Duke Xian was angered that the two sons left without bidding farewell. Indeed they had a plot. He then made troops attack Pu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Duke Xian became furious that his two sons had left without taking leave of him. Indeed they were plotting against him. He sent troops to attack Pu.

sentences.zh: 蒲人之宦者勃鞮命重耳促自殺。

translations.literal: Pu's eunuch Bo Di commanded Chong Er to hurry and commit suicide.
translations.idiomatic: An eunuch in Pu named Bo Di ordered Chong Er to commit suicide immediately.

sentences.zh: 重耳踰垣，宦者追斬其衣袪。

translations.literal: Chong Er leaped over the wall. The eunuch pursued and cut his robe sleeve.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er leaped over the wall. The eunuch pursued him and slashed at his robe sleeve.

sentences.zh: 重耳遂奔翟。

translations.literal: Chong Er then fled to Di.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er then fled to the Di people.

sentences.zh: 使人伐屈，屈城守，不可下。

translations.literal: He made people attack Qu. The Qu city defended, and it could not be conquered.
translations.idiomatic: He sent forces to attack Qu. The defenders of Qu held firm, and the city could not be taken.

sentences.zh: 是歲也，晉復假道於虞以伐虢。

translations.literal: This year, Jin again requested passage through Yu to attack Guo.
translations.idiomatic: That same year, Jin once again requested passage through Yu territory to attack Guo.

sentences.zh: 虞之大夫宮之奇諫虞君曰：「晉不可假道也，是且滅虞。」

translations.literal: Yu grand officer Gong Zhi Qi admonished Yu lord said: 'Jin not can grant road, this about extinguish Yu.'
translations.idiomatic: Yu's grand officer Gong Zhi Qi admonished the Yu lord: 'Jin cannot be granted passage. This is about to extinguish Yu.'

sentences.zh: 虞君曰：「晉我同姓，不宜伐我。」

translations.literal: Yu lord said: 'Jin I same surname, not proper attack me.'
translations.idiomatic: The Yu lord said: 'Jin and I have the same surname. It is not proper for them to attack me.'

sentences.zh: 宮之奇曰：「太伯、虞仲，太王之子也，太伯亡去，是以不嗣。

translations.literal: Gong Zhi Qi said: 'Tai Bo, Yu Zhong, Tai Wang sons, Tai Bo fled away, therefore not succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhi Qi said: 'Tai Bo and Yu Zhong were Tai Wang's sons. Tai Bo fled away, therefore he did not succeed.

sentences.zh: 虢仲、虢叔，王季之子也，為文王卿士，其記勳在王室，藏於盟府。

translations.literal: Guo Zhong and Guo Shu were Wang Ji's sons. They served as Wen Wang's qing shi. Their recorded merits are in the wang chamber, stored in the alliance treasury.
translations.idiomatic: Guo Zhong and Guo Shu were sons of Wang Ji. They served as ministers to King Wen. Records of their meritorious deeds are preserved in the royal archives and stored in the covenant treasury.

sentences.zh: 將虢是滅，何愛于虞？

translations.literal: Will Guo be extinguished, why cherish Yu?
translations.idiomatic: They will extinguish Guo. Why cherish Yu?

sentences.zh: 且虞之親能親於桓、莊之族乎？

translations.literal: Moreover Yu kinship can closer than Huan, Zhuang clans?
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, can Yu's kinship be closer than the Huan and Zhuang clans?

sentences.zh: 桓、莊之族何罪，盡滅之。

translations.literal: What crime did the Huan and Zhuang clans commit? They completely extinguished them.
translations.idiomatic: What crime had the clans of Huan and Zhuang committed? Yet they were completely destroyed.

sentences.zh: 虞之與虢，脣之與齒，脣亡則齒寒。」

translations.literal: Yu and Guo, lips and teeth, lips gone then teeth cold.'
translations.idiomatic: Yu and Guo are like lips and teeth. If the lips are gone, the teeth will be cold.'

sentences.zh: 虞公不聽，遂許晉。

translations.literal: The Yu gong did not listen, and then permitted Jin.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Yu would not heed the warning and granted permission to Jin.

sentences.zh: 宮之奇以其族去虞。

translations.literal: Gong Zhi Qi left Yu with his clan.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Zhiqi left Yu along with his entire clan.

sentences.zh: 其冬，晉滅虢，虢公丑奔周。

translations.literal: That winter, Jin extinguished Guo. Duke Chou of Guo fled to Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: That winter, Jin destroyed Guo. Duke Chou of Guo fled to the Zhou capital.

sentences.zh: 還，襲滅虞，虜虞公及其大夫井伯百里奚以媵秦穆姬，而修虞祀。

translations.literal: They returned and raided to extinguish Yu, capturing the Yu gong and his grand officer Jing Bo Bai Li Xi to accompany Qin Mu Ji, while maintaining Yu's sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: On the return, they launched a surprise attack and destroyed Yu, taking the Duke of Yu and his minister Baili Xi as attendants for Qin Mu Ji, while preserving Yu's ancestral sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 荀息牽曩所遺虞屈產之乘馬奉之獻公，獻公笑曰：「馬則吾馬，齒亦老矣！」

translations.literal: Xun Xi led previously left Yu Qu produced horses presented to Xian Gong, Xian Gong laughed said: 'Horses then my horses, teeth also old!'
translations.idiomatic: Xun Xi led the previously left horses produced by Yu and Qu and presented them to Duke Xian. Duke Xian laughed and said: 'The horses are then my horses, but their teeth are also old!'

sentences.zh: 二十三年，獻公遂發賈華等伐屈，屈潰。

translations.literal: In the twenty-third year, Duke Xian then sent Jia Hua and others to attack Qu. Qu collapsed.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Duke Xian sent Jia Hua and others to attack Qu. The city fell.

sentences.zh: 夷吾將奔翟。

translations.literal: Yi Wu was about to flee to Di.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Wu was about to flee to the Di people.

sentences.zh: 冀芮曰：「不可，重耳已在矣，今往，晉必移兵伐翟，翟畏晉，禍且及。

translations.literal: Ji Rui said: 'Not permissible, Chong Er already there, now go, Jin must shift troops attack Di, Di fears Jin, calamity about reach.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Rui said: 'Not permissible. Chong Er is already there. If you go now, Jin will certainly shift troops to attack Di. Di fears Jin—calamity will about reach.

sentences.zh: 不如走梁，梁近於秦，秦彊，吾君百歲後可以求入焉。」

translations.literal: Not as good flee Liang, Liang near Qin, Qin strong, our lord hundred years after can seek enter.'
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to flee to Liang. Liang is near Qin. Qin is strong. After our lord dies, we can seek to enter.'

sentences.zh: 遂奔梁。

translations.literal: He then fled to Liang.
translations.idiomatic: He then fled to Liang.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，晉伐翟，翟以重耳故，亦擊晉於齧桑，晉兵解而去。

translations.literal: In the twenty-fifth year, Jin attacked Di. Di, because of Chong Er, also struck Jin at Nie Sang. The Jin troops dispersed and left.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Jin attacked the Di. Because of Chong Er, the Di also counterattacked Jin at Niesang. The Jin forces withdrew.

sentences.zh: 當此時，晉彊，西有河西，與秦接境，北邊翟，東至河內。

translations.literal: At this time, Jin was strong. In the west it had He Xi, bordering Qin. In the north it bordered Di. In the east it reached He Nei.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Jin was powerful. To the west it controlled Hexi and bordered Qin. To the north it bordered the Di. To the east it reached Henan.

sentences.zh: 驪姬弟生悼子。

translations.literal: Li Ji's younger brother gave birth to Dao Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ji's younger brother bore Dao Zi.

sentences.zh: 二十六年夏，齊桓公大會諸侯於葵丘。

translations.literal: In the twenty-sixth year summer, Qi's Duke Huan held a great assembly of feudal lords at Kui Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: In summer of the twenty-sixth year, Duke Huan of Qi convened a great assembly of the feudal lords at Kuiqiu.

sentences.zh: 晉獻公病，行後，未至，逢周之宰孔。

translations.literal: Duke Xian of Jin was ill. He went after, but had not yet arrived when he met Zhou's steward Kong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian of Jin fell ill. He set out later but had not yet arrived when he encountered Kong, the Zhou steward.

sentences.zh: 宰孔曰：「齊桓公益驕，不務德而務遠略，諸侯弗平。

translations.literal: Steward Kong said: 'Qi Huan Gong increasingly arrogant, not attends virtue but attends distant strategies, feudal lords not content.
translations.idiomatic: Steward Kong said: 'Duke Huan of Qi is increasingly arrogant. He does not attend to virtue but attends to distant strategies. The feudal lords are not content.

sentences.zh: 君弟毋會，毋如晉何。」

translations.literal: Lord do not assemble, not as Jin what.'
translations.idiomatic: My lord, do not assemble. What can Jin do?'

sentences.zh: 獻公亦病，復還歸。

translations.literal: Duke Xian was also ill, and again returned home.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian also fell ill and returned home again.

sentences.zh: 病甚，乃謂荀息曰：「吾以奚齊為後，年少，諸大臣不服，恐亂起，子能立之乎？」

translations.literal: Illness severe, then told Xun Xi said: 'I make Xi Qi successor, year young, various ministers not submit, fear chaos rise, you can establish him?'
translations.idiomatic: His illness became severe. He then told Xun Xi: 'I am making Xi Qi my successor. He is young. The various ministers will not submit. I fear chaos will rise. Can you establish him?'

sentences.zh: 荀息曰：「能。」

translations.literal: Xun Xi said: 'Can.'
translations.idiomatic: Xun Xi said: 'I can.'

sentences.zh: 獻公曰：「何以為驗？」

translations.literal: Xian Gong said: 'What to make verification?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian said: 'What will serve as verification?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「使死者復生，生者不慚，為之驗。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Make dead revive, living not ashamed, make verification.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Make the dead revive, the living not ashamed—make this the verification.'

sentences.zh: 於是遂屬奚齊於荀息。

translations.literal: Thereupon they then entrusted Xi Qi to Xun Xi.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon they entrusted Xi Qi to Xun Xi.

sentences.zh: 荀息為相，主國政。

translations.literal: Xun Xi became chancellor and controlled the state government.
translations.idiomatic: Xun Xi became prime minister and took charge of state affairs.

sentences.zh: 秋九月，獻公卒。

translations.literal: In the autumn ninth month, Duke Xian died.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month of autumn, Duke Xian died.

sentences.zh: 裏克、邳鄭欲內重耳，以三公子之徒作亂，謂荀息曰：「三怨將起，秦、晉輔之，子將何如？」

translations.literal: Li Ke, Pi Zheng desired enter Chong Er, with three princes followers make chaos, told Xun Xi said: 'Three resentments will rise, Qin, Jin help them, you will how?'
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke and Pi Zheng desired to bring in Chong Er. With the three princes' followers they made chaos. They told Xun Xi: 'Three resentments will rise. Qin and Jin will help them. What will you do?'

sentences.zh: 荀息曰：「吾不可負先君言。」

translations.literal: Xun Xi said: 'I cannot betray former lord words.'
translations.idiomatic: Xun Xi said: 'I cannot betray the former lord's words.'

sentences.zh: 十月，裏克殺奚齊于喪次，獻公未葬也。

translations.literal: In the tenth month, Li Ke killed Xi Qi at the mourning place. Duke Xian had not yet been buried.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, Li Ke assassinated Xi Qi at the mourning pavilion before Duke Xian had even been buried.

sentences.zh: 荀息將死之，或曰不如立奚齊弟悼子而傅之，荀息立悼子而葬獻公。

translations.literal: Xun Xi was about to die for it. Someone said it would be better to establish Xi Qi's younger brother Dao Zi and tutor him. Xun Xi established Dao Zi and buried Duke Xian.
translations.idiomatic: Xun Xi was prepared to die for his duty. Someone suggested it would be better to establish Xi Qi's younger brother Dao Zi and act as his tutor. Xun Xi established Dao Zi and buried Duke Xian.

sentences.zh: 十一月，裏克弒悼子于朝，荀息死之。

translations.literal: In the eleventh month, Li Ke assassinated Dao Zi in the court. Xun Xi died for it.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Li Ke assassinated Dao Zi in the court. Xun Xi died in loyalty to his charge.

sentences.zh: 君子曰：「詩所謂『白珪之玷，猶可磨也，斯言之玷，不可為也』，其荀息之謂乎！

translations.literal: Gentleman said: 'Shi called 'white gui blemish, still can grind, this words blemish, not can do', its Xun Xi speak!
translations.idiomatic: The gentleman said: 'As the Shi says: 'A white gui's blemish can still be ground away. This words' blemish cannot be done.' Is this speaking of Xun Xi!

sentences.zh: 不負其言。」

translations.literal: Not betray his words.'
translations.idiomatic: He did not betray his words.'

sentences.zh: 初，獻公將伐驪戎，卜曰「齒牙為禍」。

translations.literal: Initially, Xian Gong about to attack Li Rong, divination said 'teeth fangs become calamity'.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, when Duke Xian was about to attack the Li Rong, the divination said 'teeth and fangs will become calamity'.

sentences.zh: 及破驪戎，獲驪姬，愛之，竟以亂晉。

translations.literal: When he broke the Li Rong and obtained Li Ji, he loved her. In the end this brought chaos to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: When he defeated the Lirong and captured Li Ji, he fell in love with her. In the end, this brought chaos to Jin.

sentences.zh: 裏克等已殺奚齊、悼子，使人迎公子重耳於翟，欲立之。

translations.literal: Li Ke and others had already killed Xi Qi and Dao Zi. They sent people to welcome Prince Chong Er from Di, desiring to establish him.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke and his faction had already assassinated Xi Qi and Dao Zi. They sent envoys to welcome Prince Chong Er from the Di and install him as ruler.

sentences.zh: 重耳謝曰：「負父之命出奔，父死不得修人子之禮侍喪，重耳何敢入！

translations.literal: Chong Er declined said: 'Carried father command fled, father died not able cultivate person son ritual attend mourning, Chong Er how dare enter!
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er declined, saying: 'I carried my father's command and fled. My father died and I was not able to cultivate the ritual of a filial son and attend the mourning. How dare Chong Er enter!

sentences.zh: 大夫其更立他子。」

translations.literal: Grand officers should change establish other son.'
translations.idiomatic: The grand officers should change and establish another son.'

sentences.zh: 還報裏克，裏克使迎夷吾於梁。

translations.literal: They returned and reported to Li Ke. Li Ke made them welcome Yi Wu from Liang.
translations.idiomatic: They returned and reported to Li Ke. Li Ke sent them to welcome Yi Wu from Liang.

sentences.zh: 夷吾欲往，呂省、郤芮曰：「內猶有公子可立者而外求，難信。

translations.literal: Yi Wu desired go, Lu Sheng, Xi Rui said: 'Inside still have prince can establish and outside seek, difficult trust.
translations.idiomatic: Yi Wu desired to go. Lu Sheng and Xi Rui said: 'There are still princes inside who can be established, yet we seek outside. It is difficult to trust.

sentences.zh: 計非之秦，輔彊國之威以入，恐危。」

translations.literal: Plan not of Qin, help strong state might to enter, fear danger.'
translations.idiomatic: The plan is not of Qin. Helping a strong state's might to enter—we fear danger.'

sentences.zh: 乃使郤芮厚賂秦，約曰：「即得入，請以晉河西之地與秦。」

translations.literal: Then made Xi Rui thickly bribe Qin, agreed said: 'If obtain enter, please with Jin He Xi land give Qin.'
translations.idiomatic: They then made Xi Rui thickly bribe Qin, agreeing: 'If we obtain entry, please give Jin's He Xi land to Qin.'

sentences.zh: 及遺裏克書曰：「誠得立，請遂封子於汾陽之邑。」

translations.literal: And sent Li Ke letter said: 'Truly obtain establish, please then enfeoff son at Fen Yang city.'
translations.idiomatic: They also sent Li Ke a letter: 'If truly established, please then enfeoff your son at Fen Yang's city.'

sentences.zh: 秦繆公乃發兵送夷吾於晉。

translations.literal: Qin Mu Gong then sent troops to send Yi Wu to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu of Qin then dispatched troops to escort Yi Wu to Jin.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公聞晉內亂，亦率諸侯如晉。

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong heard of Jin's internal chaos and also led the feudal lords to go to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi heard of Jin's internal chaos and also led the feudal lords to Jin.

sentences.zh: 秦兵與夷吾亦至晉，齊乃使隰朋會秦俱入夷吾，立為晉君，是為惠公。

translations.literal: Qin troops with Yi Wu also arrived at Jin. Qi then made Xi Peng meet with Qin to together enter Yi Wu and establish him as Jin's lord, who became Duke Hui.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin troops escorting Yi Wu also arrived in Jin. Qi then had Xi Peng meet with Qin to jointly install Yi Wu as ruler of Jin, who became Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公至晉之高梁而還歸。

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong arrived at Jin's Gao Liang and returned home.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi reached Gaoliang in Jin territory and then returned home.

sentences.zh: 惠公夷吾元年，使邳鄭謝秦曰：「始夷吾以河西地許君，今幸得入立。

translations.literal: Hui Gong Yi Wu first year, made Pi Zheng thank Qin said: 'Beginning Yi Wu with He Xi land promised lord, now fortunately obtain enter establish.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Hui Yi Wu's first year, he made Pi Zheng thank Qin, saying: 'At the beginning Yi Wu promised the lord He Xi land. Now fortunately I obtain entry and establishment.

sentences.zh: 大臣曰：『地者先君之地，君亡在外，何以得擅許秦者？』

translations.literal: Ministers said: 'Land is former lord land, lord fled outside, how obtain monopolize promise Qin?'
translations.idiomatic: The ministers said: 'The land is the former lord's land. The lord fled outside—how can he monopolize and promise it to Qin?'

sentences.zh: 寡人爭之弗能得，故謝秦。」

translations.literal: I contended it not able obtain, therefore thank Qin.'
translations.idiomatic: I contended for it but was not able to obtain it, therefore I thank Qin.'

sentences.zh: 亦不與裏克汾陽邑，而奪之權。

translations.literal: He also did not give Li Ke the Fen Yang city, and seized his authority.
translations.idiomatic: He also refused to grant Li Ke the city of Fenyang and stripped him of his authority.

sentences.zh: 四月，周襄王使周公忌父會齊、秦大夫共禮晉惠公。

translations.literal: In the fourth month, Zhou Xiang Wang made Zhou Gong Ji Fu meet with Qi and Qin grand officers to together perform rituals for Jin Hui Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month, King Xiang of Zhou sent the Duke of Zhou, Ji Fu, to meet with ministers from Qi and Qin and jointly perform the investiture ceremonies for Duke Hui of Jin.

sentences.zh: 惠公以重耳在外，畏裏克為變，賜裏克死。

translations.literal: Duke Hui, because Chong Er was outside, feared Li Ke would make rebellion, and granted Li Ke death.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui, fearing that Li Ke might rebel while Chong Er remained in exile, ordered Li Ke executed.

sentences.zh: 謂曰：「微裏子寡人不得立。

translations.literal: Told said: 'Without Li Zi I not able establish.
translations.idiomatic: He told him: 'Without Li Zi, I would not have been able to establish myself.

sentences.zh: 雖然，子亦殺二君一大夫，為子君者不亦難乎？」

translations.literal: Although, you also killed two lords one grand officer, for your lord not also difficult?'
translations.idiomatic: Although this is so, you also killed two lords and one grand officer. For your lord—is this not also difficult?'

sentences.zh: 裏克對曰：「不有所廢，君何以興？

translations.literal: Li Ke replied said: 'Not have something deposed, lord how rise?
translations.idiomatic: Li Ke replied: 'If not having something deposed, how can the lord rise?

sentences.zh: 欲誅之，其無辭乎？

translations.literal: Desire execute him, his without words?'
translations.idiomatic: Desiring to execute him—does he have no words?'

sentences.zh: 乃言為此！

translations.literal: Then spoke for this!
translations.idiomatic: He then spoke on behalf of this!

sentences.zh: 臣聞命矣。」

translations.literal: Minister heard command.'
translations.idiomatic: This minister has heard the command.'

sentences.zh: 遂伏劍而死。

translations.literal: He then fell on his sword and died.
translations.idiomatic: He then fell upon his sword and died.

sentences.zh: 於是邳鄭使謝秦未還，故不及難。

translations.literal: Thereupon Pi Zheng's envoy to thank Qin had not yet returned, therefore he was not caught in the difficulty.
translations.idiomatic: Pi Zheng's envoy sent to thank Qin had not yet returned, so he escaped the purge.

sentences.zh: 晉君改葬恭太子申生。

translations.literal: The Jin lord reburied Crown Prince Gong Shen Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: The ruler of Jin reburied Crown Prince Gong Shen Sheng.

sentences.zh: 秋，狐突之下國，遇申生，申生與載而告之曰：「夷吾無禮，余得請於帝，將以晉與秦，秦將祀余。」

translations.literal: Autumn, Hu Tu going down to state, met Shen Sheng, Shen Sheng with him rode and told him said: 'Yi Wu without ritual, I obtained request at Emperor, will with Jin give Qin, Qin will sacrifice to me.'
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, when Hu Tu was going down to the state, he met Shen Sheng. Shen Sheng rode with him and told him: 'Yi Wu lacks ritual. I obtained a request from the Emperor. I will give Jin to Qin. Qin will sacrifice to me.'

sentences.zh: 狐突對曰：「臣聞神不食非其宗，君其祀毋乃絕乎？

translations.literal: Hu Tu replied said: 'Minister heard spirits not eat not their ancestral temple, lord your sacrifices perhaps cut off?
translations.idiomatic: Hu Tu replied: 'This minister has heard that spirits do not accept offerings that are not from their ancestral temple. My lord, will your sacrifices not be cut off?

sentences.zh: 君其圖之。」

translations.literal: Lord should plan it.'
translations.idiomatic: My lord should plan for it.'

sentences.zh: 申生曰：「諾，吾將復請帝。

translations.literal: Shen Sheng said: 'Yes, I will again request Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: Shen Sheng said: 'Very well. I will again request the Emperor.

sentences.zh: 後十日，新城西偏將有巫者見我焉。」

translations.literal: After ten days, Xin Cheng west side will have shaman see me there.'
translations.idiomatic: After ten days, on the west side of Xin Cheng, there will be a shaman who sees me there.'

sentences.zh: 許之，遂不見。

translations.literal: He promised it, and then was not seen.
translations.idiomatic: He promised to do so, and then disappeared.

sentences.zh: 及期而往，復見，申生告之曰：「帝許罰有罪矣，弊於韓。」

translations.literal: And at time went, again seen, Shen Sheng told him said: 'Emperor permitted punish guilty, ended at Han.'
translations.idiomatic: When the time came and he went, he was seen again. Shen Sheng told him: 'The Emperor has permitted punishment of the guilty. It will end at Han.'

sentences.zh: 兒乃謠曰：「恭太子更葬矣，後十四年，晉亦不昌，昌乃在兄。」

translations.literal: Child then sang: 'Gong crown prince reburied, after fourteen years, Jin also not prosperous, prosperity then in elder brother.'
translations.idiomatic: The child then sang: 'Crown Prince Gong has been reburied. After fourteen years, Jin will also not prosper. Prosperity will then be in the elder brother.'

sentences.zh: 邳鄭使秦，聞裏克誅，乃說秦繆公曰：「呂省、郤稱、冀芮實為不從。

translations.literal: Pi Zheng envoy to Qin, heard Li Ke executed, then persuaded Qin Mu Gong said: 'Lu Sheng, Xi Cheng, Ji Rui truly are not obedient.
translations.idiomatic: Pi Zheng's envoy to Qin, hearing that Li Ke was executed, then persuaded Qin Mu Gong: 'Lu Sheng, Xi Cheng, and Ji Rui are truly not obedient.

sentences.zh: 若重賂與謀，出晉君，入重耳，事必就。」

translations.literal: If heavy bribe and plot, expel Jin lord, enter Chong Er, matter must succeed.'
translations.idiomatic: If we heavily bribe them and plot together, expel the Jin lord and bring in Chong Er—the matter will surely succeed.'

sentences.zh: 秦繆公許之，使人與歸報晉，厚賂三子。

translations.literal: Qin Mu Gong permitted it and made people return to report to Jin, thickly bribing the three sons.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu of Qin agreed and sent envoys back to Jin with lavish bribes for the three sons.

sentences.zh: 三子曰：「幣厚言甘，此必邳鄭賣我於秦。」

translations.literal: Three sons said: 'Currency thick words sweet, this must Pi Zheng sell us to Qin.'
translations.idiomatic: The three sons said: 'The currency is thick and the words are sweet. This must be Pi Zheng selling us to Qin.'

sentences.zh: 遂殺邳鄭及裏克、邳鄭之黨七輿大夫。

translations.literal: They then killed Pi Zheng and Li Ke, and Pi Zheng's party of seven chariot grand officers.
translations.idiomatic: They then executed Pi Zheng and Li Ke, along with seven high-ranking ministers who were Pi Zheng's faction.

sentences.zh: 邳鄭子豹奔秦，言伐晉，繆公弗聽。

translations.literal: Pi Zheng Zi Bao fled to Qin and spoke of attacking Jin. Mu Gong did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Pi Zheng's son Bao fled to Qin and urged an attack on Jin, but Duke Mu refused to listen.

sentences.zh: 惠公之立，倍秦地及裏克，誅七輿大夫，國人不附。

translations.literal: Duke Hui's establishment doubled Qin's land and Li Ke. He executed seven chariot grand officers. The state's people did not attach themselves.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui's enthronement promised Qin double the land and Li Ke's head. He executed seven high ministers. The people of the state did not support him.

sentences.zh: 二年，周使召公過禮晉惠公，惠公禮倨，召公譏之。

translations.literal: In the second year, Zhou made Shao Gong Guo perform rituals for Jin Hui Gong. Hui Gong's rituals were arrogant. Shao Gong criticized him.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, the Zhou court sent the Duke of Shao, Guo, to conduct the investiture ceremonies for Duke Hui of Jin. Duke Hui behaved arrogantly. The Duke of Shao rebuked him.

sentences.zh: 四年，晉饑，乞糴於秦。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Jin suffered famine and begged grain from Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Jin suffered famine and begged Qin for grain.

sentences.zh: 繆公問百里奚，百里奚曰：「天菑流行，國家代有，救菑恤鄰，國之道也。

translations.literal: Mu Gong asked Bai Li Xi, Bai Li Xi said: 'Heaven calamities circulate, states alternately have, save calamities relieve neighbors, state way.
translations.idiomatic: Mu Gong asked Bai Li Xi. Bai Li Xi said: 'Heaven's calamities circulate. States alternately have them. Saving calamities and relieving neighbors is the way of the state.

sentences.zh: 與之。」

translations.literal: Give to them.'
translations.idiomatic: Give it to them.'

sentences.zh: 邳鄭子豹曰：「伐之。」

translations.literal: Pi Zheng Zi Bao said: 'Attack them.'
translations.idiomatic: Pi Zheng's son Bao said: 'Attack them.'

sentences.zh: 繆公曰：「其君是惡，其民何罪！」

translations.literal: Mu Gong said: 'Their lord is evil, their people what crime!'
translations.idiomatic: Mu Gong said: 'Their lord is evil. What crime have their people committed!'

sentences.zh: 卒與粟，自雍屬絳。

translations.literal: In the end they gave grain, from Yong reaching to Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: In the end they provided grain, transporting it all the way from Yong to Jiang.

sentences.zh: 五年，秦饑，請糴於晉。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Qin suffered famine and requested grain from Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Qin suffered famine and requested grain from Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉君謀之，慶鄭曰：「以秦得立，已而倍其地約。

translations.literal: Jin lord consulted it, Qing Zheng said: 'With Qin obtained establishment, then doubled their land agreement.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin lord consulted about it. Qing Zheng said: 'We obtained establishment through Qin, then doubled their land agreement.

sentences.zh: 晉饑而秦貸我，今秦饑請糴，與之何疑？

translations.literal: Jin famine and Qin lent us, now Qin famine requests grain, give to them what doubt?
translations.idiomatic: When Jin suffered famine Qin lent to us. Now when Qin suffers famine and requests grain, what doubt is there in giving to them?

sentences.zh: 而謀之！」

translations.literal: And plot it!'
translations.idiomatic: And plot against them!'

sentences.zh: 虢射曰：「往年天以晉賜秦，秦弗知取而貸我。

translations.literal: Guo She said: 'Previous year heaven with Jin granted Qin, Qin not know take and lent us.
translations.idiomatic: Guo She said: 'In the previous year, heaven granted Jin to Qin. Qin did not know to take it and lent to us.

sentences.zh: 今天以秦賜晉，晉其可以逆天乎？

translations.literal: Today heaven with Qin grants Jin, Jin how can oppose heaven?
translations.idiomatic: Today heaven grants Qin to Jin. How can Jin oppose heaven?

sentences.zh: 遂伐之。」

translations.literal: Then attack them.'
translations.idiomatic: We should then attack them.'

sentences.zh: 惠公用虢射謀，不與秦粟，而發兵且伐秦。

translations.literal: Duke Hui used Guo She's plan. He did not give grain to Qin, and sent troops to attack Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui followed Guo She's advice. He refused to give grain to Qin and instead sent troops to attack Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦大怒，亦發兵伐晉。

translations.literal: Qin was greatly angered and also sent troops to attack Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Qin was furious and also sent troops to attack Jin.

sentences.zh: 六年春，秦繆公將兵伐晉。

translations.literal: In the sixth year spring, Qin Mu Gong led troops to attack Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In spring of the sixth year, Duke Mu of Qin led troops to attack Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉惠公謂慶鄭曰：「秦師深矣，柰何？」

translations.literal: Jin Hui Gong told Qing Zheng said: 'Qin army deep, what to do?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui of Jin told Qing Zheng: 'The Qin army has penetrated deeply. What shall we do?'

sentences.zh: 鄭曰：「秦內君，君倍其賂；

translations.literal: Zheng said: 'Qin brought in lord, lord doubled their bribe;
translations.idiomatic: Zheng said: 'Qin brought in the lord, and the lord doubled their bribe;

sentences.zh: 晉饑秦輸粟，秦饑而晉倍之，乃欲因其饑伐之：其深不亦宜乎！」

translations.literal: Jin famine Qin transported grain, Qin famine and Jin doubled it, then desired take advantage famine attack them: their deep not also proper!'
translations.idiomatic: When Jin suffered famine Qin transported grain, when Qin suffered famine Jin doubled it, then desired to take advantage of their famine to attack them—is their deep penetration not also proper!'

sentences.zh: 晉卜御右，慶鄭皆吉。

translations.literal: Jin divined the chariot driver and right side. Qing Zheng was all auspicious.
translations.idiomatic: Jin divined about the chariot driver and right-hand man. Qing Zheng received entirely auspicious omens.

sentences.zh: 公曰：「鄭不孫。」

translations.literal: Gong said: 'Zheng not filial.'
translations.idiomatic: The gong said: 'Zheng is not filial.'

sentences.zh: 乃更令步陽御戎，家仆徒為右，進兵。

translations.literal: He then again commanded Bu Yang to drive the chariot, family slave Tu as the right, and advanced the troops.
translations.idiomatic: He then ordered Bu Yang to drive the chariot again, with his family slave Tu as the right-hand man, and advanced the troops.

sentences.zh: 九月壬戌，秦繆公、晉惠公合戰韓原。

translations.literal: In the ninth month, Ren Xu, Qin Mu Gong and Jin Hui Gong joined battle at Han Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: On the day Renxu in the ninth month, Duke Mu of Qin and Duke Hui of Jin clashed in battle at Hanyuan.

sentences.zh: 惠公馬騺不行，秦兵至，公窘，召慶鄭為御。

translations.literal: Duke Hui's horse stumbled and would not go. Qin troops arrived. The gong was distressed and summoned Qing Zheng as driver.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui's horse stumbled and refused to move. Qin troops arrived. The duke was in dire straits and summoned Qing Zheng to drive the chariot.

sentences.zh: 鄭曰：「不用卜，敗不亦當乎！」

translations.literal: Zheng said: 'Not used divination, defeat not also proper!'
translations.idiomatic: Zheng said: 'Did not use divination. Is defeat not also proper!'

sentences.zh: 遂去。

translations.literal: He then left.
translations.idiomatic: Qing Zheng then fled.

sentences.zh: 更令梁繇靡御，虢射為右，輅秦繆公。

translations.literal: He again commanded Liang You Mi to drive, Guo She as right, and pursued Qin Mu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He then ordered Liang Youmi to drive the chariot, with Guo She as the right-hand man, and pursued Duke Mu of Qin.

sentences.zh: 繆公壯士冒敗晉軍，晉軍敗，遂失秦繆公，反獲晉公以歸。

translations.literal: Mu Gong's strong men braved and defeated the Jin army. The Jin army was defeated. They then lost Qin Mu Gong, but instead captured the Jin gong to return.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu's warriors bravely counterattacked and defeated the Jin army. The Jin forces were routed. In the confusion, they lost Duke Mu of Qin, but captured Duke Hui of Jin instead and returned with him.

sentences.zh: 秦將以祀上帝。

translations.literal: Qin was about to sacrifice him to the Shang Di.
translations.idiomatic: Qin intended to sacrifice him to the Supreme Deity.

sentences.zh: 晉君姊為繆公夫人，衰绖涕泣。

translations.literal: The Jin lord's elder sister was Mu Gong's wife. She wept in mourning garments.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Jin's elder sister was Duke Mu's consort. She wept bitterly while wearing mourning garments.

sentences.zh: 公曰：「得晉侯將以為樂，今乃如此。

translations.literal: Gong said: 'Obtained Jin hou will take as joy, now then like this.
translations.idiomatic: The gong said: 'I obtained the Jin hou and was going to take him as joy. Now it is like this.

sentences.zh: 且吾聞箕子見唐叔之初封，曰『其後必當大矣』，晉庸可滅乎！」

translations.literal: Moreover I heard Ji Zi saw Tang Shu initial enfeoffment, said 'his descendants must greatly', Jin how can extinguish!'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, I heard that Ji Zi saw Tang Shu's initial enfeoffment and said 'his descendants must greatly.' How can Jin be extinguished!'

sentences.zh: 乃與晉侯盟王城而許之歸。

translations.literal: He then allied with the Jin hou at Wang Cheng and permitted him to return.
translations.idiomatic: He then formed an alliance with the Duke of Jin at Wangcheng and allowed him to return home.

sentences.zh: 晉侯亦使呂省等報國人曰：「孤雖得歸，毋面目見社稷，卜日立子圉。」

translations.literal: Jin hou also made Lu Sheng etc. report state people said: 'I though obtain return, no face see altars, divine day establish Zi Yu.'
translations.idiomatic: The Jin hou also made Lu Sheng and others report to the state people: 'Though I obtain return, I have no face to see the altars. Divine a day to establish Zi Yu.'

sentences.zh: 晉人聞之，皆哭。

translations.literal: The Jin people heard it and all cried.
translations.idiomatic: When the people of Jin heard the news, they all wept.

sentences.zh: 秦繆公問呂省：「晉國和乎？」

translations.literal: Qin Mu Gong asked Lu Sheng: 'Jin state harmonious?'
translations.idiomatic: Qin Mu Gong asked Lu Sheng: 'Is the Jin state harmonious?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不和。

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Not harmonious.
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Not harmonious.

sentences.zh: 小人懼失君亡親，不憚立子圉，曰『必報讎，寧事戎、狄』。

translations.literal: Small people fear lose lord lose kin, not dread establish Zi Yu, said 'must avenge enmity, rather serve Rong, Di'.
translations.idiomatic: The small people fear losing their lord and kin. They do not dread establishing Zi Yu, saying 'We must avenge enmity. We would rather serve the Rong and Di.'

sentences.zh: 其君子則愛君而知罪，以待秦命，曰『必報德』。

translations.literal: Their gentlemen then love lord and know guilt, to await Qin command, said 'must repay virtue'.
translations.idiomatic: Their gentlemen love the lord and know their guilt. They await Qin's command, saying 'We must repay virtue.'

sentences.zh: 有此二故，不和。」

translations.literal: Have these two reasons, not harmonious.'
translations.idiomatic: Because of these two reasons, not harmonious.'

sentences.zh: 於是秦繆公更舍晉惠公，餽之七牢。

translations.literal: Thereupon Qin Mu Gong again lodged Jin Hui Gong and gifted him seven sets of animals.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Duke Mu of Qin housed Duke Hui of Jin once more and bestowed upon him seven sacrificial animals.

sentences.zh: 十一月，歸晉侯。

translations.literal: In the eleventh month, they returned the Jin hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, they sent the Duke of Jin home.

sentences.zh: 晉侯至國，誅慶鄭，修政教。

translations.literal: The Jin hou arrived in the state, executed Qing Zheng, and repaired the government teachings.
translations.idiomatic: Upon returning to Jin, the duke executed Qing Zheng and reformed the administration.

sentences.zh: 謀曰：「重耳在外，諸侯多利內之。」

translations.literal: Consulted said: 'Chong Er outside, feudal lords many profit bring in him.'
translations.idiomatic: They consulted: 'Chong Er is outside. Many feudal lords would profit by bringing him in.'

sentences.zh: 欲使人殺重耳於狄。

translations.literal: He desired to make people kill Chong Er at Di.
translations.idiomatic: He wanted to send assassins to kill Chong Er among the Di people.

sentences.zh: 重耳聞之，如齊。
