translations.literal: Chong Er heard of it and went to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er heard about this and fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 八年，使太子圉質秦。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, he made Crown Prince Yu a hostage in Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, he sent Crown Prince Yu as a hostage to Qin.

sentences.zh: 初，惠公亡在梁，梁伯以其女妻之，生一男一女。

translations.literal: Initially, when Hui Gong fled in Liang, Liang Bo married his daughter to him. She gave birth to one male and one female.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, while Duke Hui was in exile in Liang, the Marquis of Liang gave him his daughter in marriage. She bore him one son and one daughter.

sentences.zh: 梁伯卜之，男為人臣，女為人妾，故名男為圉，女為妾。

translations.literal: Liang Bo divined it. The male would be a minister to others, the female a concubine to others. Therefore he named the male Yu and the female Concubine.
translations.idiomatic: The Marquis of Liang consulted the oracle about them. The son would serve as a minister to others, the daughter as a concubine to others. Therefore he named the son Yu and the daughter Concubine.

sentences.zh: 十年，秦滅梁。

translations.literal: In the tenth year, Qin extinguished Liang.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Qin destroyed Liang.

sentences.zh: 梁伯好土功，治城溝，民力罷怨，其眾數相驚，曰「秦寇至」，民恐惑，秦竟滅之。

translations.literal: Liang bo liked earth works, managed city moats, people strength exhausted resented, their multitudes several times mutually alarmed, said 'Qin bandits arrive', people feared bewildered, Qin finally extinguished it.
translations.idiomatic: Liang Bo liked earthworks. He managed city moats. The people's strength was exhausted and resentful. Their multitudes several times mutually alarmed themselves, saying 'Qin bandits have arrived.' The people were fearful and bewildered. Qin finally extinguished it.

sentences.zh: 十三年，晉惠公病，內有數子。

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Jin Hui Gong was ill. He had several sons inside.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Duke Hui of Jin fell ill. He had several sons.

sentences.zh: 太子圉曰：「吾母家在梁，梁今秦滅之，我外輕於秦而內無援於國。

translations.literal: Crown prince Yu said: 'My mother family in Liang, Liang now Qin extinguished it, I outside light to Qin and inside no aid in state.
translations.idiomatic: Crown Prince Yu said: 'My mother's family is in Liang. Qin has now extinguished Liang. I am light to Qin outside and have no aid in the state inside.

sentences.zh: 君即不起，病大夫輕，更立他公子。」

translations.literal: Lord if not rise, ill grand officers light, change establish other prince.'
translations.idiomatic: If the lord does not rise, the ill grand officers are light. Change and establish another prince.'

sentences.zh: 乃謀與其妻俱亡歸。

translations.literal: He then plotted with his wife to together flee and return.
translations.idiomatic: He then conspired with his wife to flee together and return home.

sentences.zh: 秦女曰：「子一國太子，辱在此。

translations.literal: Qin woman said: 'You one state crown prince, humiliated here.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin woman said: 'You are one state's crown prince, humiliated here.

sentences.zh: 秦使婢子侍，以固子之心。

translations.literal: Qin made a maidservant attend, to strengthen your heart.
translations.idiomatic: Qin sent a maidservant to attend you, to reassure your heart.

sentences.zh: 子亡矣，我不從子，亦不敢言。」

translations.literal: You flee, I not follow you, also not dare speak.'
translations.idiomatic: You have fled. I will not follow you, nor dare I speak.'

sentences.zh: 子圉遂亡歸晉。

translations.literal: Zi Yu then fled and returned to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Yu then fled back to Jin.

sentences.zh: 十四年九月，惠公卒，太子圉立，是為懷公。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year ninth month, Hui Gong died. Crown Prince Yu was established, who became Duke Huai.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month of the fourteenth year, Duke Hui died. Crown Prince Yu ascended the throne, becoming Duke Huai.

sentences.zh: 子圉之亡，秦怨之，乃求公子重耳，欲內之。

translations.literal: Zi Yu fled. Qin resented it and then sought Prince Chong Er, desiring to bring him in.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Yu's flight angered Qin, so they sought out Prince Chong Er, desiring to install him as ruler.

sentences.zh: 子圉之立，畏秦之伐也。

translations.literal: Zi Yu's establishment feared Qin's attack.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Yu's enthronement was motivated by fear of a Qin invasion.

sentences.zh: 乃令國中諸從重耳亡者與期，期盡不到者盡滅其家。

translations.literal: He then commanded those in the state who had followed Chong Er in flight to set a deadline. Those who did not arrive by the deadline would have their families completely extinguished.
translations.idiomatic: He then ordered all those in the state who had followed Chong Er into exile to report by a deadline. Those who failed to appear would have their entire families executed.

sentences.zh: 狐突之子毛及偃從重耳在秦，弗肯召。

translations.literal: Hu Tu's sons Mao and Yan followed Chong Er in Qin and were not willing to be summoned.
translations.idiomatic: Hu Tu's sons Mao and Yan were with Chong Er in Qin and refused to answer the summons.

sentences.zh: 懷公怒，囚狐突。

translations.literal: Duke Huai was angered and imprisoned Hu Tu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huai was furious and imprisoned Hu Tu.

sentences.zh: 突曰：「臣子事重耳有年數矣，今召之，是教之反君也。

translations.literal: Tu said: 'Minister sons served Chong Er have years number, now summon them, this teaches them oppose lord.
translations.idiomatic: Tu said: 'The minister's sons have served Chong Er for several years. Now summoning them teaches them to oppose their lord.

sentences.zh: 何以教之？」

translations.literal: How teach them?'
translations.idiomatic: How to teach them?'

sentences.zh: 懷公卒殺狐突。

translations.literal: Duke Huai finally killed Hu Tu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huai eventually had Hu Tu executed.

sentences.zh: 秦繆公乃發兵送內重耳，使人告欒、郤之黨為內應，殺懷公於高梁，入重耳。

translations.literal: Qin Mu Gong then sent troops to bring in Chong Er. He made people tell the Luan and Xi party to act as inner support, killed Duke Huai at Gao Liang, and entered Chong Er.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu of Qin then dispatched troops to escort Chong Er back. He instructed the factions of Luan and Xi to provide internal support, assassinated Duke Huai at Gaoliang, and installed Chong Er as ruler.

sentences.zh: 重耳立，是為文公。

translations.literal: Chong Er was established, who became Duke Wen.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er ascended the throne, becoming Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 晉文公重耳，晉獻公之子也。

translations.literal: Jin Wen Gong Chong Er was Jin Xian Gong's son.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen of Jin, Chong Er, was a son of Duke Xian of Jin.

sentences.zh: 自少好士，年十七，有賢士五人：曰趙衰；

translations.literal: From young liked scholars, year seventeen, had worthy scholars five people: said Zhao Cui;
translations.idiomatic: From young he liked scholars. At age seventeen, he had five worthy scholars: Zhao Cui;

sentences.zh: 狐偃咎犯，文公舅也；

translations.literal: Hu Yan Jiu Fan, Wen Gong maternal uncle;
translations.idiomatic: Hu Yan Jiu Fan, Duke Wen's maternal uncle;

sentences.zh: 賈佗；

translations.literal: Jia Tuo;
translations.idiomatic: Jia Tuo;

sentences.zh: 先軫；

translations.literal: Xian Zhen;
translations.idiomatic: Xian Zhen;

sentences.zh: 魏武子。

translations.literal: Wei Wu Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Wu Zi.

sentences.zh: 自獻公為太子時，重耳固已成人矣。

translations.literal: From when Xian Gong was crown prince, Chong Er was indeed already an adult.
translations.idiomatic: Even when Duke Xian was still crown prince, Chong Er had already come of age.

sentences.zh: 獻公即位，重耳年二十一。

translations.literal: When Xian Gong ascended the throne, Chong Er was twenty-one years old.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Xian ascended the throne, Chong Er was twenty-one years old.

sentences.zh: 獻公十三年，以驪姬故，重耳備蒲城守秦。

translations.literal: In Xian Gong's thirteenth year, because of Li Ji, Chong Er prepared Pu city to defend against Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xian's thirteenth year, because of Li Ji's influence, Chong Er fortified Pu city to defend against Qin.

sentences.zh: 獻公二十一年，獻公殺太子申生，驪姬讒之，恐，不辭獻公而守蒲城。

translations.literal: In Xian Gong's twenty-first year, Xian Gong killed Crown Prince Shen Sheng. Li Ji had slandered him. Chong Er feared and, without bidding farewell to Xian Gong, defended Pu city.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xian's twenty-first year, Duke Xian had Crown Prince Shen Sheng executed after Li Ji slandered him. Chong Er became fearful and, without taking leave of Duke Xian, fortified himself in Pu city.

sentences.zh: 獻公二十二年，獻公使宦者履鞮趣殺重耳。

translations.literal: In Xian Gong's twenty-second year, Xian Gong made the eunuch Lu Di hurry to kill Chong Er.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xian's twenty-second year, Duke Xian sent the eunuch Ludi to hasten Chong Er's assassination.

sentences.zh: 重耳踰垣，宦者逐斬其衣袪。

translations.literal: Chong Er leaped over the wall. The eunuch pursued and cut his robe sleeve.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er leaped over the wall. The eunuch pursued him and slashed at his robe sleeve.

sentences.zh: 重耳遂奔狄。

translations.literal: Chong Er then fled to Di.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er then fled to the Di people.

sentences.zh: 狄，其母國也。

translations.literal: Di was his mother's state.
translations.idiomatic: The Di were his mother's people.

sentences.zh: 是時重耳年四十三。

translations.literal: At this time Chong Er was forty-three years old.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Chong Er was forty-three years old.

sentences.zh: 從此五士，其餘不名者數十人，至狄。

translations.literal: These five scholars followed him. Several dozen others whose names are not recorded also arrived at Di.
translations.idiomatic: These five scholars accompanied him. Several dozen others whose names are not recorded also reached the Di.

sentences.zh: 狄伐咎如，得二女：以長女妻重耳，生伯鯈、叔劉；

translations.literal: Di attacked Jiu Ru, obtained two women: with elder daughter married Chong Er, gave birth Bo Tao, Shu Liu;
translations.idiomatic: Di attacked Jiu Ru and obtained two women. They married the elder daughter to Chong Er. She gave birth to Bo Tao and Shu Liu;

sentences.zh: 以少女妻趙衰，生盾。

translations.literal: they married the younger daughter to Zhao Cui. She gave birth to Dun.
translations.idiomatic: They gave their younger daughter in marriage to Zhao Cui. She bore him Dun.

sentences.zh: 居狄五歲而晉獻公卒，裏克已殺奚齊、悼子，乃使人迎，欲立重耳。

translations.literal: He lived in Di for five years when Jin Xian Gong died. Li Ke had already killed Xi Qi and Dao Zi. He then made people welcome Chong Er, desiring to establish him.
translations.idiomatic: He had lived among the Di for five years when Duke Xian of Jin died. Li Ke had already assassinated Xi Qi and Dao Zi. He then sent envoys to welcome Chong Er, intending to install him as ruler.

sentences.zh: 重耳畏殺，因固謝，不敢入。

translations.literal: Chong Er feared being killed, and therefore firmly declined. He dared not enter.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er feared assassination and therefore firmly declined the invitation. He dared not return.

sentences.zh: 已而晉更迎其弟夷吾立之，是為惠公。

translations.literal: Soon after, Jin again welcomed his younger brother Yi Wu and established him, who became Duke Hui.
translations.idiomatic: Soon after, Jin welcomed his younger brother Yi Wu and installed him as ruler, who became Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 惠公七年，畏重耳，乃使宦者履鞮與壯士欲殺重耳。

translations.literal: In Hui Gong's seventh year, he feared Chong Er and made the eunuch Lu Di with strong men desire to kill Chong Er.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Hui's seventh year, fearing Chong Er's growing influence, he sent the eunuch Ludi along with warriors to assassinate Chong Er.

sentences.zh: 重耳聞之，乃謀趙衰等曰：「始吾奔狄，非以為可用與，以近易通，故且休足。

translations.literal: Chong Er heard it, then consulted Zhao Cui etc. said: 'Beginning I fled Di, not because thought usable with, because near easy communicate, therefore temporarily rest feet.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er heard of it and then consulted Zhao Cui and others: 'At the beginning I fled to Di, not because I thought it usable with them, but because it was near and easy to communicate with, so I temporarily rested my feet.

sentences.zh: 休足久矣，固願徙之大國。

translations.literal: I have rested my feet for a long time. I firmly wish to move to a great state.
translations.idiomatic: I have rested long enough. I firmly wish to move to a great state.

sentences.zh: 夫齊桓公好善，志在霸王，收恤諸侯。

translations.literal: Duke Huan of Qi loved goodness. His ambition was in becoming hegemon king. He gathered and relieved the feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi was fond of worthy men. His ambition was to become hegemon king. He gathered and aided the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 今聞管仲、隰朋死，此亦欲得賢佐，盍往乎？」

translations.literal: Now heard Guan Zhong, Xi Peng died, he also desires obtain worthy assistants, why go?'
translations.idiomatic: Now I hear Guan Zhong and Xi Peng have died. He also desires to obtain worthy assistants. Why not go?'

sentences.zh: 於是遂行。

translations.literal: Thereupon he then went.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he set out.

sentences.zh: 重耳謂其妻曰：「待我二十五年不來，乃嫁。」

translations.literal: Chong Er told his wife said: 'Wait me twenty-five years not come, then marry.'
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er told his wife: 'Wait for me twenty-five years. If I do not come, then marry.'

sentences.zh: 其妻笑曰：「犁二十五年，吾冢上柏大矣。

translations.literal: His wife laughed said: 'Plow twenty-five years, my tomb cypress big.'
translations.idiomatic: His wife laughed and said: 'After plowing for twenty-five years, the cypress on my tomb will be big.'

sentences.zh: 雖然，妾待子。」

translations.literal: Although, concubine wait you.'
translations.idiomatic: Although that is so, this concubine will wait for you.'

sentences.zh: 重耳居狄凡十二年而去。

translations.literal: Chong Er lived in Di for a total of twelve years and left.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er lived among the Di for a total of twelve years before departing.

sentences.zh: 過衛，衛文公不禮。

translations.literal: He passed through Wei. Duke Wen of Wei was not courteous.
translations.idiomatic: He passed through Wei. Duke Wen of Wei showed him no courtesy.

sentences.zh: 去，過五鹿，饑而從野人乞食，野人盛土器中進之。

translations.literal: He left and passed through Wu Lu. He was hungry and begged food from a rustic. The rustic filled an earth vessel and presented it.
translations.idiomatic: He departed and passed through Wulu. Famished, he begged food from a peasant. The peasant filled an earthen bowl with dirt and presented it to him.

sentences.zh: 重耳怒。

translations.literal: Chong Er was angered.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er became furious.

sentences.zh: 趙衰曰：「土者，有土也，君其拜受之。」

translations.literal: Zhao Cui said: 'Earth means have land, lord should bow receive it.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Cui said: 'Earth means having land. My lord should bow and receive it.'

sentences.zh: 至齊，齊桓公厚禮，而以宗女妻之，有馬二十乘，重耳安之。

translations.literal: He arrived at Qi. Duke Huan of Qi was thickly courteous and married his clan daughter to him. He had twenty chariots of horses. Chong Er was at ease.
translations.idiomatic: He arrived in Qi. Duke Huan of Qi treated him with great courtesy and gave him a daughter of the royal clan in marriage. He was provided with twenty chariot teams. Chong Er settled comfortably.

sentences.zh: 重耳至齊二歲而桓公卒，會豎刀等為內亂，齊孝公之立，諸侯兵數至。

translations.literal: Chong Er had been in Qi for two years when Duke Huan died. Shu Dao and others made internal chaos. During Duke Xiao of Qi's establishment, feudal lords' troops arrived several times.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er had been in Qi for two years when Duke Huan died. At that time, Shudao and others created internal disorder. During Duke Xiao of Qi's succession, the troops of feudal lords arrived several times.

sentences.zh: 留齊凡五歲。

translations.literal: He stayed in Qi for a total of five years.
translations.idiomatic: He remained in Qi for a total of five years.

sentences.zh: 重耳愛齊女，毋去心。

translations.literal: Chong Er loved the Qi woman and had no intention to leave.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er loved his Qi wife and had no desire to leave.

sentences.zh: 趙衰、咎犯乃於桑下謀行。

translations.literal: Zhao Cui and Jiu Fan then plotted going under the mulberry tree.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Cui and Jiufan then plotted their departure beneath the mulberry tree.

sentences.zh: 齊女侍者在桑上聞之，以告其主。

translations.literal: The Qi woman's attendant on the mulberry tree heard it and told her master.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi woman's attendant, who was up in the mulberry tree, heard their conversation and informed her mistress.

sentences.zh: 其主乃殺侍者，勸重耳趣行。

translations.literal: Her master then killed the attendant and urged Chong Er to hurry and go.
translations.idiomatic: Her mistress then killed the attendant and urged Chong Er to depart immediately.

sentences.zh: 重耳曰：「人生安樂，孰知其他！

translations.literal: Chong Er said: 'Human life peaceful joyful, who knows other!
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er said: 'Human life is peaceful and joyful. Who knows anything else!

sentences.zh: 必死於此，不能去。」

translations.literal: Must die here, cannot leave.'
translations.idiomatic: I must die here. I cannot leave.'

sentences.zh: 齊女曰：「子一國公子，窮而來此，數士者以子為命。

translations.literal: Qi woman said: 'You one state prince, poor and came here, several scholars take you as fate.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi woman said: 'You are one state's prince. You came here in poverty. Several scholars take you as their fate.

sentences.zh: 子不疾反國，報勞臣，而懷女德，竊為子羞之。

translations.literal: If you do not quickly return to your state and repay the toiling ministers, but cherish a woman's virtue, I secretly am ashamed for you.
translations.idiomatic: If you do not quickly return to your state to reward your loyal ministers, but instead cling to a woman's affection, I am secretly ashamed for you.

sentences.zh: 且不求，何時得功？」

translations.literal: Moreover not seek, when obtain merit?'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, if you do not seek it, when will you obtain merit?'

sentences.zh: 乃與趙衰等謀，醉重耳，載以行。

translations.literal: She then plotted with Zhao Cui and others, intoxicated Chong Er, and loaded him to go.
translations.idiomatic: She then conspired with Zhao Cui and the others. They got Chong Er drunk and carried him away in a cart.

sentences.zh: 行遠而覺，重耳大怒，引戈欲殺咎犯。

translations.literal: They went far and he awoke. Chong Er was greatly angered and drew his spear desiring to kill Jiu Fan.
translations.idiomatic: They had gone some distance when he awoke. Chong Er was furious and drew his spear, intending to kill Jiufan.

sentences.zh: 咎犯曰：「殺臣成子，偃之願也。」

translations.literal: Jiu Fan said: 'Kill minister complete you, Yan wish.'
translations.idiomatic: Jiu Fan said: 'Kill this minister to complete you—that is Yan's wish.'

sentences.zh: 重耳曰：「事不成，我食舅氏之肉。」

translations.literal: Chong Er said: 'Matter not succeed, I eat maternal uncle clan flesh.'
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er said: 'If the matter does not succeed, I will eat my maternal uncle's clan's flesh.'

sentences.zh: 咎犯曰：「事不成，犯肉腥臊，何足食！」

translations.literal: Jiu Fan said: 'Matter not succeed, Fan flesh rank rancid, what sufficient eat!'
translations.idiomatic: Jiu Fan said: 'If the matter does not succeed, Fan's flesh will be rank and rancid. What is sufficient to eat!'

sentences.zh: 乃止，遂行。

translations.literal: He then stopped and went.
translations.idiomatic: He then desisted and they continued on their way.

sentences.zh: 過曹，曹共公不禮，欲觀重耳駢脅。

translations.literal: He passed through Cao. Duke Gong of Cao was not courteous and desired to view Chong Er's conjoined ribs.
translations.idiomatic: He passed through Cao. Duke Gong of Cao showed him no courtesy and wished to inspect Chong Er's unusual rib structure.

sentences.zh: 曹大夫釐負羈曰：「晉公子賢，又同姓，窮來過我，柰何不禮！」

translations.literal: Cao grand officer Xi Fu Ji said: 'Jin prince worthy, moreover same surname, poor came passed me, how not courteous!'
translations.idiomatic: Cao's grand officer Xi Fu Ji said: 'The Jin prince is worthy. Moreover he is of the same surname. He came in poverty and passed through me. How can he not be courteous!'

sentences.zh: 共公不從其謀。

translations.literal: Duke Gong did not follow his plan.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Gong refused to go along with the scheme.

sentences.zh: 負羈乃私遺重耳食，置璧其下。

translations.literal: Fu Ji then privately sent Chong Er food and placed jade underneath it.
translations.idiomatic: Fujii then secretly sent Chong Er food, concealing a jade disc beneath it.

sentences.zh: 重耳受其食，還其璧。

translations.literal: Chong Er received his food and returned his jade.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er accepted the food but returned the jade disc.

sentences.zh: 去，過宋。

translations.literal: He left and passed through Song.
translations.idiomatic: He departed and passed through Song.

sentences.zh: 宋襄公新困兵於楚，傷於泓，聞重耳賢，乃以國禮禮於重耳。

translations.literal: Song Duke Xiang had newly been distressed by troops from Chu and wounded at Hong. He heard Chong Er was worthy and then treated Chong Er with state rituals.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiang of Song had recently suffered military defeat at the hands of Chu and been wounded at the Hong River. Hearing that Chong Er was a worthy man, he treated him with full state honors.

sentences.zh: 宋司馬公孫固善於咎犯，曰：「宋小國新困，不足以求入，更之大國。」

translations.literal: Song Si Ma Gong Sun Gu good with Jiu Fan, said: 'Song small state newly distressed, not sufficient to seek enter, change to great state.'
translations.idiomatic: Song's Si Ma Gong Sun Gu was friendly with Jiu Fan and said: 'Song is a small state newly distressed. It is not sufficient to seek entry. Change to a great state.'

sentences.zh: 乃去。

translations.literal: They then left.
translations.idiomatic: They then departed.

sentences.zh: 過鄭，鄭文公弗禮。

translations.literal: He passed through Zheng. Duke Wen of Zheng was not courteous.
translations.idiomatic: He passed through Zheng. Duke Wen of Zheng showed him no courtesy.

sentences.zh: 鄭叔瞻諫其君曰：「晉公子賢，而其從者皆國相，且又同姓。

translations.literal: Zheng Shu Zhan admonished his lord said: 'Jin prince worthy, and his followers all state chancellors, moreover also same surname.
translations.idiomatic: Zheng Shu Zhan admonished his lord: 'The Jin prince is worthy, and his followers are all state chancellors. Moreover, they are also of the same surname.

sentences.zh: 鄭之出自厲王，而晉之出自武王。」

translations.literal: Zheng comes from Li Wang, and Jin comes from Wu Wang.'
translations.idiomatic: Zheng comes from King Li, and Jin comes from King Wu.'

sentences.zh: 鄭君曰：「諸侯亡公子過此者眾，安可盡禮！」

translations.literal: Zheng lord said: 'Feudal lords fled princes passing here many, how can exhaust courtesy!'
translations.idiomatic: The Zheng lord said: 'There are many princes fleeing from feudal lords who pass through here. How can I be courteous to all!'

sentences.zh: 叔瞻曰：「君不禮，不如殺之，且後為國患。」

translations.literal: Shu Zhan said: 'Lord not courteous, not as good kill him, moreover later become state calamity.'
translations.idiomatic: Shu Zhan said: 'If the lord is not courteous, it would be better to kill him, lest he later become a calamity for the state.'

sentences.zh: 鄭君不聽。

translations.literal: The Zheng lord did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zheng refused to heed the advice.

sentences.zh: 重耳去之楚，楚成王以適諸侯禮待之，重耳謝不敢當。

translations.literal: Chong Er went to Chu. King Cheng of Chu treated him with the ritual suitable for feudal lords. Chong Er declined and dared not accept.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er went to Chu. King Cheng of Chu treated him with the full ceremonial honors due to a feudal lord. Chong Er declined, saying he dared not accept such treatment.

sentences.zh: 趙衰曰：「子亡在外十餘年，小國輕子，況大國乎？

translations.literal: Zhao Cui said: 'You fled outside ten remaining years, small states slight you, moreover great states?
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Cui said: 'You have fled outside for more than ten years. Small states slight you. What about great states?

sentences.zh: 今楚大國而固遇子，子其毋讓，此天開子也。」

translations.literal: Now Chu great state and surely meet you, you should not decline, this heaven opens you.'
translations.idiomatic: Now Chu is a great state and will surely meet with you. You should not decline—this is heaven opening for you.'

sentences.zh: 遂以客禮見之。

translations.literal: He then saw him with guest rituals.
translations.idiomatic: He then received him with the honors due to a distinguished guest.

sentences.zh: 成王厚遇重耳，重耳甚卑。

translations.literal: King Cheng treated Chong Er thickly. Chong Er was very humble.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng treated Chong Er with great generosity. Chong Er behaved with utmost humility.

sentences.zh: 成王曰：「子即反國，何以報寡人？」

translations.literal: Cheng Wang said: 'You if return state, what with repay me?'
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng said: 'If you return to your state, what will you use to repay me?'

sentences.zh: 重耳曰：「羽毛齒角玉帛，君王所餘，未知所以報。」

translations.literal: Chong Er said: 'Feathers fur teeth horns jade silks, lord king what remains, not know what with repay.'
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er said: 'Feathers, fur, teeth, horns, jade, and silks—these are what the lord king has remaining. I do not know what to use to repay.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「雖然，何以報不穀？」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'Although this, what with repay unworthy?'
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'Although this is so, what will you use to repay the unworthy one?'

sentences.zh: 重耳曰：「即不得已，與君王以兵車會平原廣澤，請辟王三舍。」

translations.literal: Chong Er said: 'If not able avoid, with lord king with war chariots meet plain broad marsh, please avoid wang three she.'
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er said: 'If I cannot avoid it, I will meet the lord king with war chariots on the plain and broad marsh. I ask to avoid the wang by three she.'

sentences.zh: 楚將子玉怒曰：「王遇晉公子至厚，今重耳言不孫，請殺之。」

translations.literal: Chu general Zi Yu angered said: 'Wang treats Jin prince extremely thick, now Chong Er words not filial, please kill him.'
translations.idiomatic: Chu general Zi Yu was angered and said: 'The wang treats the Jin prince extremely thickly. Now Chong Er's words are not filial. Please kill him.'

sentences.zh: 成王曰：「晉公子賢而困於外久，從者皆國器，此天所置，庸可殺乎？

translations.literal: Cheng Wang said: 'Jin prince worthy and distressed outside long, followers all state vessels, this heaven placed, how can kill?
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng said: 'The Jin prince is worthy and has been distressed outside for a long time. His followers are all state vessels. This is heaven's placement. How can he be killed?

sentences.zh: 且言何以易之！」

translations.literal: Moreover words what with change it!'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, what can change his words!'

sentences.zh: 居楚數月，而晉太子圉亡秦，秦怨之；

translations.literal: Lived Chu several months, and Jin crown prince Yu fled Qin, Qin resented it;
translations.idiomatic: He lived in Chu for several months, and Jin's Crown Prince Yu fled to Qin. Qin resented it;

sentences.zh: 聞重耳在楚，乃召之。

translations.literal: they heard Chong Er was in Chu and then summoned him.
translations.idiomatic: Hearing that Chong Er was in Chu, they summoned him.

sentences.zh: 成王曰：「楚遠，更數國乃至晉。

translations.literal: Cheng Wang said: 'Chu far, pass several states then reach Jin.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng said: 'Chu is far. You must pass through several states to reach Jin.

sentences.zh: 秦晉接境，秦君賢，子其勉行！」

translations.literal: Qin Jin border adjacent, Qin lord worthy, you should diligently go!'
translations.idiomatic: Qin and Jin share a border. The Qin lord is worthy. You should diligently go!'

sentences.zh: 厚送重耳。

translations.literal: He thickly sent Chong Er.
translations.idiomatic: He provided Chong Er with generous gifts for the journey.

sentences.zh: 重耳至秦，繆公以宗女五人妻重耳，故子圉妻與往。

translations.literal: Chong Er arrived at Qin. Mu Gong married five clan daughters to Chong Er. Zi Yu's former wife also went with them.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er arrived in Qin. Duke Mu gave him five daughters of the royal clan in marriage. Zi Yu's former wife was also included among them.

sentences.zh: 重耳不欲受，司空季子曰：「其國且伐，況其故妻乎！

translations.literal: Chong Er not desired receive, Si Kong Ji Zi said: 'His state about attack, moreover his former wife!
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er did not desire to receive them. Si Kong Ji Zi said: 'His state is about to be attacked. What about his former wife!

sentences.zh: 且受以結秦親而求入，子乃拘小禮，忘大丑乎！」

translations.literal: Moreover receive to tie Qin kinship and seek enter, you then constrained small ritual, forget great shame!'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, receive them to tie Qin kinship and seek entry. You are then constrained by small ritual and forget great shame!'

sentences.zh: 遂受。

translations.literal: He then received them.
translations.idiomatic: He accepted them.

sentences.zh: 繆公大歡，與重耳飲。

translations.literal: Mu Gong was greatly happy and drank with Chong Er.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu was overjoyed and drank with Chong Er.

sentences.zh: 趙衰歌黍苗詩。

translations.literal: Zhao Cui sang the 'Shu Miao' poem.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Cui sang the poem 'The Millet Sprouts.'

sentences.zh: 繆公曰：「知子欲急反國矣。」

translations.literal: Mu Gong said: 'Know you desire urgently return state.'
translations.idiomatic: Mu Gong said: 'I know you desire to urgently return to your state.'

sentences.zh: 趙衰與重耳下，再拜曰：「孤臣之仰君，如百穀之望時雨。」

translations.literal: Zhao Cui with Chong Er descended, twice bowed said: 'Orphan minister looks up lord, like hundred grains hope season rain.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Cui and Chong Er descended and twice bowed, saying: 'The orphan minister looks up to the lord like the hundred grains hope for seasonable rain.'

sentences.zh: 是時晉惠公十四年秋。

translations.literal: At this time it was Jin Hui Gong's fourteenth year autumn.
translations.idiomatic: This was in autumn of Duke Hui's fourteenth year.

sentences.zh: 惠公以九月卒，子圉立。

translations.literal: Hui Gong died in the ninth month. Zi Yu was established.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui died in the ninth month. Zi Yu ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 十一月，葬惠公。

translations.literal: In the eleventh month, they buried Duke Hui.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Duke Hui was buried.

sentences.zh: 十二月，晉國大夫欒、郤等聞重耳在秦，皆陰來勸重耳、趙衰等反國，為內應甚眾。

translations.literal: In the twelfth month, Jin state's grand officers Luan, Xi and others heard Chong Er was in Qin. They all secretly came to urge Chong Er, Zhao Cui and others to return to the state, acting as very many inner supporters.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, high ministers of Jin including Luan, Xi and others, hearing that Chong Er was in Qin, all secretly came to urge Chong Er and Zhao Cui and the others to return to their country, pledging to provide extensive internal support.

sentences.zh: 於是秦繆公乃發兵與重耳歸晉。

translations.literal: Thereupon Qin Mu Gong then sent troops with Chong Er to return to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Duke Mu of Qin dispatched troops to escort Chong Er back to Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉聞秦兵來，亦發兵拒之。

translations.literal: Jin heard Qin troops were coming and also sent troops to resist them.
translations.idiomatic: Jin, hearing that Qin troops were approaching, also dispatched forces to oppose them.

sentences.zh: 然皆陰知公子重耳入也。

translations.literal: However, they all secretly knew that Prince Chong Er was entering.
translations.idiomatic: However, they all secretly knew that Prince Chong Er was among those entering.

sentences.zh: 唯惠公之故貴臣呂、郤之屬不欲立重耳。

translations.literal: Only Duke Hui's former noble ministers of the Lu and Xi kind did not desire to establish Chong Er.
translations.idiomatic: Only Duke Hui's former high ministers from the Lü and Xi clans opposed installing Chong Er.

sentences.zh: 重耳出亡凡十九歲而得入，時年六十二矣，晉人多附焉。

translations.literal: Chong Er fled for a total of nineteen years and obtained entry. At that time he was sixty-two years old. Many Jin people attached themselves to him.
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er had been in exile for nineteen years before gaining entry. At that time he was sixty-two years old. Many people of Jin rallied to his side.

sentences.zh: 文公元年春，秦送重耳至河。

translations.literal: In Duke Wen's first year spring, Qin sent Chong Er to the river.
translations.idiomatic: In spring of Duke Wen's first year, Qin escorted Chong Er to the Yellow River.

sentences.zh: 咎犯曰：「臣從君周旋天下，過亦多矣。

translations.literal: Jiu Fan said: 'Minister followed lord wandered world, faults also many.
translations.idiomatic: Jiu Fan said: 'The minister has followed the lord and wandered the world. Faults have also been many.

sentences.zh: 臣猶知之，況於君乎？

translations.literal: Minister still knows it, moreover lord?
translations.idiomatic: The minister still knows it. What about the lord?

sentences.zh: 請從此去矣。」

translations.literal: Please from this leave.'
translations.idiomatic: Please let me leave from here.'

sentences.zh: 重耳曰：「若反國，所不與子犯共者，河伯視之！」

translations.literal: Chong Er said: 'If return state, what not with Zi Fan share, He Bo watch it!'
translations.idiomatic: Chong Er said: 'If I return to the state, what I do not share with Zi Fan—let He Bo watch it!'

sentences.zh: 乃投璧河中，以與子犯盟。

translations.literal: He then threw the jade into the river middle, to ally with Zi Fan.
translations.idiomatic: He then cast the jade disc into the river as an oath to Zi Fan.

sentences.zh: 是時介子推從，在船中，乃笑曰：「天實開公子，而子犯以為己功而要市於君，固足羞也。

translations.literal: At this time Jie Zi Tui followed, in boat middle, then laughed said: 'Heaven truly opened prince, but Zi Fan takes as own merit and demands reward from lord, indeed sufficient shame.
translations.idiomatic: At this time Jie Zi Tui followed. He was in the boat middle, and then laughed, saying: 'Heaven truly opened for the prince, but Zi Fan takes it as his own merit and demands reward from the lord. Indeed it is sufficient shame.

sentences.zh: 吾不忍與同位。」

translations.literal: I not endure with same position.'
translations.idiomatic: I cannot endure to be in the same position.'

sentences.zh: 乃自隱渡河。

translations.literal: He then hid himself and crossed the river.
translations.idiomatic: He then secretly crossed the river.

sentences.zh: 秦兵圍令狐，晉軍于廬柳。

translations.literal: Qin troops surrounded Ling Hu. Jin troops were at Lu Liu.
translations.idiomatic: Qin troops besieged Linghu. Jin forces were positioned at Luliu.

sentences.zh: 二月辛丑，咎犯與秦晉大夫盟于郇。

translations.literal: In the second month, Xin Chou, Jiu Fan allied with Qin and Jin grand officers at Xun.
translations.idiomatic: On the day Xinchou in the second month, Jiufan formed an alliance with ministers from Qin and Jin at Xun.

sentences.zh: 壬寅，重耳入于晉師。

translations.literal: On Ren Yin, Chong Er entered the Jin army.
translations.idiomatic: On the day Renyin, Chong Er joined the Jin army.

sentences.zh: 丙午，入于曲沃。

translations.literal: On Bing Wu, he entered Qu Wo.
translations.idiomatic: On the day Bingwu, he entered Quwo.

sentences.zh: 丁未，朝于武宮，即位為晉君，是為文公。

translations.literal: On Ding Wei, he courted at the Wu Palace, ascended the throne as Jin's lord, who became Duke Wen.
translations.idiomatic: On the day Dingwei, he performed the morning court at the Wu Palace and ascended the throne as ruler of Jin, becoming Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 群臣皆往。

translations.literal: All the ministers went.
translations.idiomatic: All the ministers attended.

sentences.zh: 懷公圉奔高梁。

translations.literal: Duke Huai Yu fled to Gao Liang.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huai Yu fled to Gaoliang.

sentences.zh: 戊申，使人殺懷公。

translations.literal: On Wu Shen, he made people kill Duke Huai.

sentences.zh: 懷公故大臣呂省、郤芮本不附文公，文公立，恐誅，乃欲與其徒謀燒公宮，殺文公。

translations.literal: Duke Huai's former ministers Lu Sheng and Xi Rui originally did not attach to Duke Wen. When Duke Wen was established, they feared execution, and then desired to plot with their followers to burn the gong palace and kill Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 文公不知。

translations.literal: Duke Wen did not know.

sentences.zh: 始嘗欲殺文公宦者履鞮知其謀，欲以告文公，解前罪，求見文公。

translations.literal: The eunuch Lu Di, who had once desired to kill Duke Wen, knew of their plot. He desired to tell Duke Wen to resolve his previous crime and sought to see Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 文公不見，使人讓曰：「蒲城之事，女斬予袪。

translations.literal: Wen Gong not see, made people reproach said: 'Pu city matter, you cut my robe sleeve.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen did not see him and made people reproach, saying: 'The Pu city matter—you cut my robe sleeve.

sentences.zh: 其後我從狄君獵，女為惠公來求殺我。

translations.literal: After that, when I followed the Di lord hunting, you came on behalf of Duke Hui to seek to kill me.

sentences.zh: 惠公與女期三日至，而女一日至，何速也？

translations.literal: Hui Gong with you agreed three days arrive, but you one day arrived, why so fast?
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui agreed with you to arrive in three days, but you arrived in one day. Why so fast?

sentences.zh: 女其念之。」

translations.literal: You should think of it.'

sentences.zh: 宦者曰：「臣刀鋸之餘，不敢以二心事君倍主，故得罪於君。

translations.literal: Eunuch said: 'Minister knife saw remainder, dared not with two hearts serve lord betray master, therefore offended lord.
translations.idiomatic: The eunuch said: 'This minister is a remainder of knife and saw. I dared not serve the lord with two hearts and betray my master. Therefore I offended the lord.

sentences.zh: 君已反國，其毋蒲、翟乎？

translations.literal: Lord already returned state, his mother Pu, Di?
translations.idiomatic: The lord has already returned to the state. Is his mother from Pu or Di?

sentences.zh: 且管仲射鉤，桓公以霸。

translations.literal: Moreover, Guan Zhong shot a hook, and Duke Huan became hegemon.

sentences.zh: 今刑餘之人以事告而君不見，禍又且及矣。」

translations.literal: Now punishment remainder person with matter told and lord not see, calamity again about reach.'
translations.idiomatic: Now a punishment remainder person tells of the matter and the lord does not see him—calamity will again about reach.'

sentences.zh: 於是見之，遂以呂、郤等告文公。

translations.literal: Thereupon he saw him, and then told Duke Wen about Lu, Xi and others.

sentences.zh: 文公欲召呂、郤，呂、郤等黨多，文公恐初入國，國人賣己，乃為微行，會秦繆公於王城，國人莫知。

translations.literal: Duke Wen desired to summon Lu and Xi. Lu and Xi's party was many. Duke Wen feared that upon initially entering the state, the state people would betray him. He then made a secret journey and met Qin Mu Gong at Wang Cheng. The state people did not know.

sentences.zh: 三月己丑，呂、郤等果反，焚公宮，不得文公。

translations.literal: In the third month, Ji Chou, Lu, Xi and others indeed rebelled, burned the gong palace, but did not obtain Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 文公之衛徒與戰，呂、郤等引兵欲奔，秦繆公誘呂、郤等，殺之河上，晉國復而文公得歸。

translations.literal: Duke Wen's Wei followers fought with them. Lu and Xi led troops desiring to flee. Qin Mu Gong lured Lu and Xi, killed them on the river bank. The Jin state was restored and Duke Wen obtained return.

sentences.zh: 夏，迎夫人於秦，秦所與文公妻者卒為夫人。

translations.literal: In summer, he welcomed the lady from Qin. The one Qin had married to Duke Wen finally became the lady.

sentences.zh: 秦送三千人為衛，以備晉亂。

translations.literal: Qin sent three thousand as guards, to prepare for Jin chaos.

sentences.zh: 文公修政，施惠百姓。

translations.literal: Duke Wen repaired the government and bestowed favor on the common people.

sentences.zh: 賞從亡者及功臣，大者封邑，小者尊爵。

translations.literal: He rewarded those who had followed in flight and meritorious ministers. The great ones were enfeoffed with cities, the small ones honored with ranks.

sentences.zh: 未盡行賞，周襄王以弟帶難出居鄭地，來告急晉。

translations.literal: Before he had exhausted bestowing rewards, Zhou Xiang Wang, with his younger brother Dai in calamity, went out and resided in Zheng land. He came to urgently tell Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉初定，欲發兵，恐他亂起，是以賞從亡未至隱者介子推。

translations.literal: Jin was initially settled. He desired to send troops but feared other chaos would rise. Therefore, the reward for those who followed in flight had not yet reached the hidden Jie Zi Tui.

sentences.zh: 推亦不言祿，祿亦不及。

translations.literal: Tui also did not speak of emolument, and emolument also did not reach him.

sentences.zh: 推曰：「獻公子九人，唯君在矣。

translations.literal: Tui said: 'Xian Gong princes nine people, only lord remained.
translations.idiomatic: Tui said: 'Duke Xian's nine princes—only the lord remained.

sentences.zh: 惠、懷無親，外內棄之；

translations.literal: Hui, Huai without kin, outside inside abandoned them;
translations.idiomatic: Hui and Huai had no kin. Outside and inside abandoned them;

sentences.zh: 天未絕晉，必將有主，主晉祀者，非君而誰？

translations.literal: Heaven not cut off Jin, must will have lord, lord Jin sacrifices, not lord then who?
translations.idiomatic: Heaven has not cut off Jin. It must have a lord. Who but the lord would be the one to maintain Jin's sacrifices?

sentences.zh: 天實開之，二三子以為己力，不亦誣乎？

translations.literal: Heaven truly opened it, two three sons take as own strength, not also false?
translations.idiomatic: Heaven truly opened it. For the two or three sons to take it as their own strength—is this not also false?

sentences.zh: 竊人之財，猶曰是盜，況貪天之功以為己力乎？

translations.literal: Steal person wealth, still called is thief, moreover greedy heaven merit take as own strength?
translations.idiomatic: Stealing a person's wealth is still called thievery. What about greedily taking heaven's merit as one's own strength?

sentences.zh: 下冒其罪，上賞其姦，上下相蒙，難與處矣！」

translations.literal: Below risk their crime, above reward their treachery, upper lower mutually deceive, difficult with dwell!'
translations.idiomatic: Below they risk their crimes, above reward their treachery. Upper and lower mutually deceive each other. It is difficult to dwell with them!'

sentences.zh: 其母曰：「盍亦求之，以死誰懟？」

translations.literal: His mother said: 'Why also seek it, with death who resent?'
translations.idiomatic: His mother said: 'Why not also seek it? With death, who would resent?'

sentences.zh: 推曰：「尤而效之，罪有甚焉。

translations.literal: Tui said: 'Blame and imitate it, crime has greater.
translations.idiomatic: Tui said: 'To blame it and imitate it—the crime is greater.

sentences.zh: 且出怨言，不食其祿。」

translations.literal: Moreover issue resentful words, not eat their emolument.'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, to issue resentful words and not eat their emolument.'

sentences.zh: 母曰：「亦使知之，若何？」

translations.literal: Mother said: 'Also make know it, how?'
translations.idiomatic: Mother said: 'Also make them know it. How?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「言，身之文也；

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Words, body pattern;
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'Words are the body's pattern;

sentences.zh: 身欲隱，安用文之？

translations.literal: body desires hide, why use pattern it?
translations.idiomatic: the body desires to hide, why use its pattern?

sentences.zh: 文之，是求顯也。」

translations.literal: Pattern it, this seeks manifest.'
translations.idiomatic: To pattern it is to seek manifestation.'

sentences.zh: 其母曰：「能如此乎？

translations.literal: His mother said: 'Able like this?
translations.idiomatic: His mother said: 'Able to be like this?

sentences.zh: 與女偕隱。」

translations.literal: With you together hide.'
translations.idiomatic: I will hide together with you.'

sentences.zh: 至死不復見。

translations.literal: Until death he was not seen again.

sentences.zh: 介子推從者憐之，乃懸書宮門曰：「龍欲上天，五蛇為輔。

translations.literal: Jie Zi Tui followers pitied him, then hung writing palace gate said: 'Dragon desires ascend heaven, five snakes as auxiliary.
translations.idiomatic: Jie Zi Tui's followers pitied him and then hung writing on the palace gate: 'The dragon desires to ascend heaven, five snakes as auxiliary.

sentences.zh: 龍已升雲，四蛇各入其宇，一蛇獨怨，終不見處所。」

translations.literal: Dragon already ascended clouds, four snakes each entered their dwellings, one snake alone resentful, finally not see place.'
translations.idiomatic: The dragon has already ascended the clouds. Four snakes each entered their dwellings. One snake alone resentful, finally not seeing the place.'

sentences.zh: 文公出，見其書，曰：「此介子推也。

translations.literal: Wen Gong went out, saw his writing, said: 'This Jie Zi Tui.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen went out and saw his writing: 'This is Jie Zi Tui.

sentences.zh: 吾方憂王室，未圖其功。」

translations.literal: I just worrying wang chamber, not planned his merit.'
translations.idiomatic: I was just worrying about the wang chamber. I had not planned his merit.'

sentences.zh: 使人召之，則亡。

translations.literal: He made people summon him, but he was gone.

sentences.zh: 遂求所在，聞其入綿上山中，於是文公環綿上山中而封之，以為介推田，號曰介山，「以記吾過，且旌善人」。

translations.literal: Then sought location, heard entered Mian Shang mountain middle, thereupon Wen Gong surrounded Mian Shang mountain middle and enfeoffed it, took as Jie Tui field, named Jie mountain, 'to record my error, and commend good person'.
translations.idiomatic: He then sought his location. He heard he had entered Mian Shang mountain. Thereupon Duke Wen surrounded Mian Shang mountain and enfeoffed it, taking it as Jie Tui's field, naming it Jie mountain 'to record my error, and to commend the good person'.

sentences.zh: 從亡賤臣壺叔曰；

translations.literal: Followed fled humble minister Hu Shu said;
translations.idiomatic: The humble minister who followed in flight, Hu Shu, said;

sentences.zh: 「君三行賞，賞不及臣，敢請罪。」

translations.literal: 'Lord three times bestowed reward, reward not reached minister, dare request punishment.'
translations.idiomatic: 'The lord has three times bestowed reward. The reward has not reached this minister. I dare to request punishment.'

sentences.zh: 文公報曰：「夫導我以仁義，防我以德惠，此受上賞。

translations.literal: Wen Gong replied said: 'That guided me with benevolence righteousness, defended me with virtue favor, this received upper reward.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen replied: 'He who guided me with benevolence and righteousness, defended me with virtue and favor—this receives the upper reward.

sentences.zh: 輔我以行，卒以成立，此受次賞。

translations.literal: He who assisted me in conduct and finally established me—this receives secondary reward.

sentences.zh: 矢石之難，汗馬之勞，此復受次賞。

translations.literal: The difficulties of arrows and stones, the labors of sweating horses—this again receives secondary reward.

sentences.zh: 若以力事我而無補吾缺者，此［復］受次賞。

translations.literal: If with strength served me and no supplemented my deficiencies, this [again] received secondary reward.
translations.idiomatic: If with strength he served me but did not supplement my deficiencies—this [again] receives secondary reward.

sentences.zh: 三賞之後，故且及子。」

translations.literal: Three rewards after, therefore temporarily reach you.'
translations.idiomatic: After the three rewards, therefore I will temporarily reach you.'

sentences.zh: 晉人聞之，皆說。

translations.literal: The Jin people heard it and were all pleased.

sentences.zh: 二年春，秦軍河上，將入王。

translations.literal: In the second year spring, Qin troops were on the river, about to enter the wang.

sentences.zh: 趙衰曰；

translations.literal: Zhao Cui said;

sentences.zh: 「求霸莫如入王尊周。

translations.literal: 'Seek hegemony not like enter wang honor Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: 'Seeking hegemony, nothing is better than entering the wang to honor Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周晉同姓，晉不先入王，後秦入之，毋以令于天下。

translations.literal: Zhou and Jin have the same surname. If Jin does not first enter the wang, and later Qin enters it, there will be no commanding the world.

sentences.zh: 方今尊王，晉之資也。」

translations.literal: Just now honor wang, Jin resource.'
translations.idiomatic: Just now honoring the wang is Jin's resource.'

sentences.zh: 三月甲辰，晉乃發兵至陽樊，圍溫，入襄王于周。

translations.literal: In the third month, Jia Chen, Jin then sent troops to Yang Fan, surrounded Wen, and entered Xiang Wang into Zhou.

sentences.zh: 四月，殺王弟帶。

translations.literal: In the fourth month, they killed the wang's younger brother Dai.

sentences.zh: 周襄王賜晉河內陽樊之地。

translations.literal: Zhou Xiang Wang granted Jin the lands of He Nei and Yang Fan.

sentences.zh: 四年，楚成王及諸侯圍宋，宋公孫固如晉告急。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Chu Cheng Wang and the feudal lords surrounded Song. Song's Gong Sun Gu went to Jin to urgently tell them.

sentences.zh: 先軫曰：「報施定霸，於今在矣。」

translations.literal: Xian Zhen said: 'Repay bestow establish hegemony, at present here.'
translations.idiomatic: Xian Zhen said: 'To repay bestowal is to establish hegemony. At present it is here.'

sentences.zh: 狐偃曰：「楚新得曹而初婚於衛，若伐曹、衛，楚必救之，則宋免矣。」

translations.literal: Hu Yan said: 'Chu newly obtained Cao and initially married at Wei, if attack Cao, Wei, Chu must save them, then Song freed.'
translations.idiomatic: Hu Yan said: 'Chu has newly obtained Cao and initially married at Wei. If we attack Cao and Wei, Chu will surely save them, then Song will be freed.'

sentences.zh: 於是晉作三軍。

translations.literal: Thereupon Jin made three armies.

sentences.zh: 趙衰舉郤縠將中軍，郤臻佐之；

translations.literal: Zhao Cui raised Xi Hu will middle army, Xi Zhen assisted him;
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Cui raised Xi Hu to command the middle army, with Xi Zhen assisting him;

sentences.zh: 使狐偃將上軍，狐毛佐之，命趙衰為卿；

translations.literal: made Hu Yan command upper army, Hu Mao assisted him, commanded Zhao Cui as qing;
translations.idiomatic: made Hu Yan command the upper army, with Hu Mao assisting him, and commanded Zhao Cui to be qing;

sentences.zh: 欒枝將下軍，先軫佐之；

translations.literal: Luan Zhi commanded lower army, Xian Zhen assisted him;
translations.idiomatic: Luan Zhi commanded the lower army, with Xian Zhen assisting him;

sentences.zh: 荀林父御戎，魏犫為右：往伐。

translations.literal: Xun Lin Fu drove chariot, Wei Chou as right: went attack.
translations.idiomatic: Xun Lin Fu drove the chariot, Wei Chou as right: went to attack.

sentences.zh: 冬十二月，晉兵先下山東，而以原封趙衰。

translations.literal: In winter twelfth month, the Jin troops first went down to Shan Dong, and enfeoffed Zhao Cui with Yuan.

sentences.zh: 五年春，晉文公欲伐曹，假道於衛，衛人弗許。

translations.literal: In the fifth year spring, Jin Wen Gong desired to attack Cao. He requested passage through Wei, but the Wei people did not permit it.

sentences.zh: 還自河南度，侵曹，伐衛。

translations.literal: He returned and crossed from He Nan, invaded Cao, and attacked Wei.

sentences.zh: 正月，取五鹿。

translations.literal: In the first month, he took Wu Lu.

sentences.zh: 二月，晉侯、齊侯盟于斂盂。

translations.literal: In the second month, the Jin hou and Qi hou allied at Lian Yu.

sentences.zh: 衛侯請盟晉，晉人不許。

translations.literal: The Wei hou requested to ally with Jin, but the Jin people did not permit it.

sentences.zh: 衛侯欲與楚，國人不欲，故出其君以說晉。

translations.literal: The Wei hou desired alliance with Chu. The state people did not desire it, therefore they expelled their lord to please Jin.

sentences.zh: 衛侯居襄牛，公子買守衛。

translations.literal: The Wei hou resided at Xiang Niu. Prince Mai guarded Wei.

sentences.zh: 楚救衛，不卒。

translations.literal: Chu came to save Wei, but did not complete it.

sentences.zh: 晉侯圍曹。

translations.literal: The Jin hou surrounded Cao.

sentences.zh: 三月丙午，晉師入曹，數之以其不用釐負羈言，而用美女乘軒者三百人也。

translations.literal: In the third month, Bing Wu, the Jin army entered Cao. They reproached them for not using Xi Fu Ji's words, but for using three hundred beautiful women riding in chariots.

sentences.zh: 令軍毋入僖負羈宗家以報德。

translations.literal: He commanded the army not to enter Xi Fu Ji's ancestral home to repay virtue.

sentences.zh: 楚圍宋，宋復告急晉。

translations.literal: Chu surrounded Song. Song again urgently told Jin.

sentences.zh: 文公欲救則攻楚，為楚嘗有德，不欲伐也；

translations.literal: Wen Gong desired save then attack Chu, because Chu once had virtue, not desired attack;
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen desired to save, then attack Chu. Because Chu once had virtue toward him, he did not desire to attack;

sentences.zh: 欲釋宋，宋又嘗有德於晉：患之。

translations.literal: Desired release Song, Song also once had virtue to Jin: troubled it.
translations.idiomatic: He desired to release Song. Song also once had virtue toward Jin. He was troubled by it.

sentences.zh: 先軫曰：「執曹伯，分曹、衛地以與宋，楚急曹、衛，其勢宜釋宋。」

translations.literal: Xian Zhen said: 'Seize Cao bo, divide Cao, Wei lands to give Song, Chu urgent Cao, Wei, its situation suitable release Song.'
translations.idiomatic: Xian Zhen said: 'Seize the Cao bo, divide Cao and Wei lands to give to Song. Chu is urgent about Cao and Wei. The situation is suitable to release Song.'

sentences.zh: 於是文公從之，而楚成王乃引兵歸。

translations.literal: Thereupon Duke Wen followed it, and Chu Cheng Wang then led troops back.

sentences.zh: 楚將子玉曰：「王遇晉至厚，今知楚急曹、衛而故伐之，是輕王。」

translations.literal: Chu general Zi Yu said: 'Wang treats Jin extremely thick, now knows Chu urgent Cao, Wei and deliberately attacks them, this slight wang.'
translations.idiomatic: Chu general Zi Yu said: 'The wang treats Jin extremely thickly. Now he knows Chu is urgent about Cao and Wei and deliberately attacks them. This slights the wang.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「晉侯亡在外十九年，困日久矣，果得反國，險阸盡知之，能用其民，天之所開，不可當。」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'Jin hou fled outside nineteen years, distressed days long, indeed obtained return state, dangers narrows all knows them, able use his people, heaven what opened, not can resist.'
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'The Jin hou fled outside for nineteen years. He has been distressed for a long time. If he indeed obtains return to the state, he knows all the dangers and narrows. He is able to use his people. This is what heaven has opened. It cannot be resisted.'

sentences.zh: 子玉請曰：「非敢必有功，願以閒執讒慝之口也。」

translations.literal: Zi Yu requested said: 'Not dare must have merit, wish with interval seize slander evil mouths.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Yu requested: 'I do not dare to be certain of merit. I wish to seize the mouths of slanderers and evil-doers in the interval.'

sentences.zh: 楚王怒，少與之兵。

translations.literal: The Chu wang was angered and gave him few troops.

sentences.zh: 於是子玉使宛春告晉：「請復衛侯而封曹，臣亦釋宋。」

translations.literal: Thereupon Zi Yu made Wan Chun tell Jin: 'Please restore Wei hou and enfeoff Cao, minister also release Song.'
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Zi Yu made Wan Chun tell Jin: 'Please restore the Wei hou and enfeoff Cao. This minister will also release Song.'

sentences.zh: 咎犯曰：「子玉無禮矣，君取一，臣取二，勿許。」

translations.literal: Jiu Fan said: 'Zi Yu without ritual, lord takes one, minister takes two, do not permit.'
translations.idiomatic: Jiu Fan said: 'Zi Yu lacks ritual. The lord takes one, the minister takes two. Do not permit it.'

sentences.zh: 先軫曰：「定人之謂禮。

translations.literal: Xian Zhen said: 'Settle people called ritual.
translations.idiomatic: Xian Zhen said: 'To settle people is called ritual.

sentences.zh: 楚一言定三國，子一言而亡之，我則毋禮。

translations.literal: Chu with one word settled three states. You with one word would perish it. I then have no ritual.

sentences.zh: 不許楚，是棄宋也。

translations.literal: Not permitting Chu—this abandons Song.

sentences.zh: 不如私許曹、衛以誘之，執宛春以怒楚，既戰而後圖之。」

translations.literal: Not as good privately permit Cao, Wei to lure them, seize Wan Chun to anger Chu, after battle then plan it.'
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to privately permit Cao and Wei to lure them, seize Wan Chun to anger Chu, and after the battle then plan for it.'

sentences.zh: 晉侯乃囚宛春於衛，且私許復曹、衛。

translations.literal: The Jin hou then imprisoned Wan Chun at Wei, and privately permitted the restoration of Cao and Wei.

sentences.zh: 曹、衛告絕於楚。

translations.literal: Cao and Wei announced they were breaking with Chu.

sentences.zh: 楚得臣怒，擊晉師，晉師退。

translations.literal: Chu's De Chen was angered and struck the Jin army. The Jin army retreated.

sentences.zh: 軍吏曰：「為何退？」

translations.literal: Army officer said: 'Why retreat?'
translations.idiomatic: The army officer said: 'Why retreat?'

sentences.zh: 文公曰：「昔在楚，約退三舍，可倍乎！」

translations.literal: Wen Gong said: 'Formerly in Chu, agreed retreat three she, can double?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen said: 'Formerly in Chu, we agreed to retreat three she. Can we double-cross?'

sentences.zh: 楚師欲去，得臣不肯。

translations.literal: The Chu army desired to leave, but De Chen was not willing.

sentences.zh: 四月戊辰，宋公、齊將、秦將與晉侯次城濮。

translations.literal: In the fourth month, Wu Chen, the Song gong, Qi general, Qin general camped with the Jin hou at Cheng Pu.

sentences.zh: 己巳，與楚兵合戰，楚兵敗，得臣收餘兵去。

translations.literal: On Ji Si, they joined battle with Chu troops. Chu troops were defeated. De Chen gathered the remaining troops and left.

sentences.zh: 甲午，晉師還至衡雍，作王宮于踐土。

translations.literal: On Jia Wu, the Jin army returned to Heng Yong and made a wang palace at Jian Tu.

sentences.zh: 初，鄭助楚，楚敗，懼，使人請盟晉侯。

translations.literal: Initially, Zheng assisted Chu. Chu was defeated. They feared and made people request alliance with the Jin hou.

sentences.zh: 晉侯與鄭伯盟。

translations.literal: The Jin hou allied with the Zheng bo.

sentences.zh: 五月丁未，獻楚俘於周，駟介百乘，徒兵千。

translations.literal: In the fifth month, Ding Wei, they presented Chu captives to Zhou—chariot armor of a hundred chariots, foot soldiers of a thousand.

sentences.zh: 天子使王子虎命晉侯為伯，賜大輅，彤弓矢百，玈弓矢千，秬鬯一卣，珪瓚，虎賁三百人。

translations.literal: The Tian Zi made Wang Zi Hu command the Jin hou as bo, granting a great chariot, vermilion bows and arrows of a hundred, black bows and arrows of a thousand, black millet wine of one vessel, a gui ladle, and tiger braves of three hundred people.

sentences.zh: 晉侯三辭，然后稽首受之。

translations.literal: The Jin hou declined three times, then kowtowed and received it.

sentences.zh: 周作晉文侯命：「王若曰：父義和，丕顯文、武，能慎明德，昭登於上，布聞在下，維時上帝集厥命于文、武。

translations.literal: Zhou made Jin Wen Hou command: 'Wang like said: Father righteous harmony, greatly manifest Wen, Wu, able cautious bright virtue, bright ascended on high, spread heard below, just then Shang Di gathered their mandate at Wen, Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou made the Jin Wen Hou command: 'The wang like said: Father righteous harmony, greatly manifest Wen and Wu, able to be cautious of bright virtue, bright ascended on high, spread heard below. Just then the Shang Di gathered their mandate at Wen and Wu.

sentences.zh: 恤朕身、繼予一人永其在位。」

translations.literal: Sympathize my body, succeed I one person eternally their in position.'
translations.idiomatic: Sympathize with my body, succeed me one person eternally in their position.'

sentences.zh: 於是晉文公稱伯。

translations.literal: Thereupon Jin Wen Gong was styled as bo.

sentences.zh: 癸亥，王子虎盟諸侯於王庭。

translations.literal: On Gui Hai, Wang Zi Hu allied the feudal lords at the wang court.

sentences.zh: 晉焚楚軍，火數日不息，文公嘆。

translations.literal: Jin burned the Chu army. The fire did not extinguish for several days. Duke Wen sighed.

sentences.zh: 左右曰：「勝楚而君猶憂，何？」

translations.literal: Left right said: 'Defeated Chu and lord still worries, why?'
translations.idiomatic: The attendants said: 'We defeated Chu and the lord still worries. Why?'

sentences.zh: 文公曰：「吾聞能戰勝安者唯聖人，是以懼。

translations.literal: Wen Gong said: 'I heard able battle defeat peace only sage, therefore fear.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen said: 'I heard that those able to battle and defeat peace are only sages. Therefore I fear.

sentences.zh: 且子玉猶在，庸可喜乎！」

translations.literal: Moreover Zi Yu still there, how can rejoice!'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, Zi Yu is still there. How can I rejoice!'

sentences.zh: 子玉之敗而歸，楚成王怒其不用其言，貪與晉戰，讓責子玉，子玉自殺。

translations.literal: Zi Yu was defeated and returned. Chu Cheng Wang was angered that he did not use his words, was greedy to battle with Jin, reproached and blamed Zi Yu. Zi Yu committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 晉文公曰：「我擊其外，楚誅其內，內外相應。」

translations.literal: Jin Wen Gong said: 'I struck their outside, Chu executed their inside, inside outside mutually respond.'
translations.idiomatic: Jin Wen Gong said: 'I struck their outside, Chu executed their inside. Inside and outside mutually respond.'

sentences.zh: 於是乃喜。

translations.literal: Thereupon he then rejoiced.

sentences.zh: 六月，晉人復入衛侯。

translations.literal: In the sixth month, the Jin people again entered the Wei hou.

sentences.zh: 壬午，晉侯度河北歸國。

translations.literal: On Ren Wu, the Jin hou crossed north of the He and returned to the state.

sentences.zh: 行賞，狐偃為首。

translations.literal: He conducted rewards, with Hu Yan as the head.

sentences.zh: 或曰：「城濮之事，先軫之謀。」

translations.literal: Someone said: 'Cheng Pu matter, Xian Zhen plan.'
translations.idiomatic: Someone said: 'The Cheng Pu matter was Xian Zhen's plan.'

sentences.zh: 文公曰：「城濮之事，偃說我毋失信。

translations.literal: Wen Gong said: 'Cheng Pu matter, Yan persuaded me not lose trust.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen said: 'The Cheng Pu matter—Yan persuaded me not to lose trust.

sentences.zh: 先軫曰『軍事勝為右』，吾用之以勝。

translations.literal: Xian Zhen said 'military matters victory as right', I used it to win.
translations.idiomatic: Xian Zhen said 'military matters take victory as right.' I used it to win.

sentences.zh: 然此一時之說，偃言萬世之功，柰何以一時之利而加萬世功乎？

translations.literal: However this one time words, Yan spoke ten thousand generations merit, how with one time profit add ten thousand generations merit?
translations.idiomatic: However, this is one time's words. Yan spoke of ten thousand generations' merit. How can one time's profit be added to ten thousand generations' merit?

sentences.zh: 是以先之。」

translations.literal: Therefore placed him first.'
translations.idiomatic: Therefore I placed him first.'

sentences.zh: 冬，晉侯會諸侯於溫，欲率之朝周。

translations.literal: In winter, the Jin hou assembled the feudal lords at Wen, desiring to lead them to court Zhou.

sentences.zh: 力未能，恐其有畔者，乃使人言周襄王狩于河陽。

translations.literal: His strength was not yet able. He feared there were defectors. He then made people say that Zhou Xiang Wang was hunting at He Yang.

sentences.zh: 壬申，遂率諸侯朝王於踐土。

translations.literal: On Ren Shen, he then led the feudal lords to court the wang at Jian Tu.

sentences.zh: 孔子讀史記至文公，曰「諸侯無召王」、「王狩河陽」者，春秋諱之也。

translations.literal: Kong Zi read shi ji to Wen Gong, said 'feudal lords not summon wang', 'wang hunted He Yang' , Chun Qiu avoided it.
translations.idiomatic: Kong Zi read the shi ji to Wen Gong and said 'feudal lords do not summon wang', 'wang hunted at He Yang'—the Chun Qiu avoided it.

sentences.zh: 丁丑，諸侯圍許。

translations.literal: On Ding Chou, the feudal lords surrounded Xu.

sentences.zh: 曹伯臣或說晉侯曰：「齊桓公合諸侯而國異姓，今君為會而滅同姓。

translations.literal: Cao bo minister someone persuaded Jin hou said: 'Qi Huan Gong united feudal lords and strengthened different surnames, now lord for assembly and extinguishes same surname.
translations.idiomatic: A Cao bo minister persuaded the Jin hou, saying: 'Qi Huan Gong united the feudal lords and strengthened different surnames. Now the lord for the assembly extinguishes the same surname.

sentences.zh: 曹，叔振鐸之後；

translations.literal: Cao, Shu Zhen Duo after;
translations.idiomatic: Cao is Shu Zhen Duo's descendant;

sentences.zh: 晉，唐叔之後。

translations.literal: Jin is Tang Shu's descendant.

sentences.zh: 合諸侯而滅兄弟，非禮。」

translations.literal: United feudal lords and extinguish brothers, not ritual.'
translations.idiomatic: United the feudal lords and extinguished brothers—this is not ritual.'

sentences.zh: 晉侯說，復曹伯。

translations.literal: The Jin hou was pleased and restored the Cao bo.

sentences.zh: 於是晉始作三行。

translations.literal: Thereupon Jin began to make three rows.

sentences.zh: 荀林父將中行，先縠將右行，先蔑將左行。

translations.literal: Xun Lin Fu commanded the middle row, Xian Hu commanded the right row, Xian Mie commanded the left row.

sentences.zh: 七年，晉文公、秦繆公共圍鄭，以其無禮於文公亡過時，及城濮時鄭助楚也。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, Jin Wen Gong and Qin Mu Gong together surrounded Zheng, because of its discourtesy to Wen Gong when he fled and passed through, and at Cheng Pu time Zheng assisted Chu.

sentences.zh: 圍鄭，欲得叔瞻。

translations.literal: They surrounded Zheng, desiring to obtain Shu Zhan.

sentences.zh: 叔瞻聞之，自殺。

translations.literal: Shu Zhan heard of it and committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 鄭持叔瞻告晉。

translations.literal: Zheng held Shu Zhan's corpse and told Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉曰：「必得鄭君而甘心焉。」

translations.literal: Jin said: 'Must obtain Zheng lord and satisfy heart.'
translations.idiomatic: Jin said: 'We must obtain the Zheng lord and satisfy our hearts.'

sentences.zh: 鄭恐，乃閒令使謂秦繆公曰：「亡鄭厚晉，於晉得矣，而秦未為利。

translations.literal: Zheng feared, then secretly commanded envoy told Qin Mu Gong said: 'Perish Zheng enrich Jin, at Jin obtained, but Qin not yet benefited.
translations.idiomatic: Zheng feared, and then secretly commanded an envoy to tell Qin Mu Gong: 'Perishing Zheng enriches Jin. At Jin it is obtained, but Qin has not yet benefited.

sentences.zh: 君何不解鄭，得為東道交？」

translations.literal: Lord why not relieve Zheng, obtain become eastern road ally?'
translations.idiomatic: Why doesn't the lord relieve Zheng and obtain to become eastern road allies?'

sentences.zh: 秦伯說，罷兵。

translations.literal: The Qin lord was pleased and dismissed his troops.

sentences.zh: 晉亦罷兵。

translations.literal: Jin also dismissed its troops.

sentences.zh: 九年冬，晉文公卒，子襄公歡立。

translations.literal: In the ninth year, winter, Jin Wen Gong died, and his son Xiang Gong Huan was established.

sentences.zh: 是歲鄭伯亦卒。

translations.literal: That same year, the Zheng lord also died.

sentences.zh: 鄭人或賣其國於秦，秦繆公發兵往襲鄭。

translations.literal: Some Zheng people sold their country to Qin, and Qin Mu Gong dispatched troops to go attack Zheng.

sentences.zh: 十二月，秦兵過我郊。

translations.literal: In the twelfth month, Qin troops passed through our outskirts.

sentences.zh: 襄公元年春，秦師過周，無禮，王孫滿譏之。

translations.literal: In Xiang Gong's first year, spring, the Qin army passed through Zhou without courtesy, and Wang Sun Man mocked them.

sentences.zh: 兵至滑，鄭賈人弦高將市于周，遇之，以十二牛勞秦師。

translations.literal: The troops arrived at Hua. Zheng merchant Xian Gao, going to trade at Zhou, encountered them and greeted the Qin army with twelve oxen.

sentences.zh: 秦師驚而還，滅滑而去。

translations.literal: The Qin army was startled and returned, extinguished Hua and departed.

sentences.zh: 晉先軫曰：「秦伯不用蹇叔，反其眾心，此可擊。」

translations.literal: Jin Xian Zhen said: 'Qin lord not use Jian Shu, turned against their multitude hearts, this can attack.'
translations.idiomatic: Jin Xian Zhen said: 'The Qin lord did not use Jian Shu, turning against the hearts of their multitude. This can be attacked.'

sentences.zh: 欒枝曰：「未報先君施於秦，擊之，不可。」

translations.literal: Luan Zhi said: 'Not yet repaid former lord's favor to Qin, attack them, not permissible.'
translations.idiomatic: Luan Zhi said: 'We have not yet repaid our former lord's favor to Qin. Attacking them is not permissible.'

sentences.zh: 先軫曰：「秦侮吾孤，伐吾同姓，何德之報？」

translations.literal: Xian Zhen said: 'Qin insulted our orphan, attacked our same surname, what virtue's repayment?'
translations.idiomatic: Xian Zhen said: 'Qin insulted our orphan, attacked our same surname. What virtue's repayment is this?'

sentences.zh: 遂擊之。

translations.literal: They then attacked them.

sentences.zh: 襄公墨衰绖。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong wore black mourning garments.

sentences.zh: 四月，敗秦師于殽，虜秦三將孟明視、西乞秫、白乙丙以歸。

translations.literal: In the fourth month, they defeated the Qin army at Xiao and captured the three Qin generals Meng Ming Shi, Xi Qi Shu, and Bai Yi Bing to return.

sentences.zh: 遂墨以葬文公。

translations.literal: They then used black for burying Wen Gong.

sentences.zh: 文公夫人秦女，謂襄公曰：「秦欲得其三將戮之。」

translations.literal: Wen Gong lady Qin woman, told Xiang Gong said: 'Qin desires obtain their three generals execute them.'
translations.idiomatic: Wen Gong's lady, a Qin woman, told Xiang Gong: 'Qin desires to obtain their three generals and execute them.'

sentences.zh: 公許，遣之。

translations.literal: The duke permitted it and sent them away.

sentences.zh: 先軫聞之，謂襄公曰：「患生矣。」

translations.literal: Xian Zhen heard it, told Xiang Gong said: 'Trouble born.'
translations.idiomatic: Xian Zhen heard it and told Xiang Gong: 'Trouble has been born.'

sentences.zh: 軫乃追秦將。

translations.literal: Zhen then pursued the Qin generals.

sentences.zh: 秦將渡河，已在船中，頓首謝，卒不反。

translations.literal: The Qin generals had crossed the river and were already in the boats. They knocked their heads in thanks but ultimately did not return.

sentences.zh: 後三年，秦果使孟明伐晉，報殽之敗，取晉汪以歸。

translations.literal: Three years later, Qin indeed sent Meng Ming to attack Jin, repaying the defeat at Xiao, and took Wang of Jin to return.

sentences.zh: 四年，秦繆公大興兵伐我，度河，取王官，封殽尸而去。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, Qin Mu Gong greatly raised troops to attack us, crossed the river, took Wang Guan, buried the Xiao corpses, and departed.

sentences.zh: 晉恐，不敢出，遂城守。

translations.literal: Jin feared and dared not go out, so they walled and defended.

sentences.zh: 五年，晉伐秦，取新城，報王官役也。

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Jin attacked Qin, took Xin Cheng, repaying the Wang Guan campaign.

sentences.zh: 六年，趙衰成子、欒貞子、咎季子犯、霍伯皆卒。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Zhao Shuai Cheng Zi, Luan Zhen Zi, Jiu Ji Zi Fan, and Huo Bo all died.

sentences.zh: 趙盾代趙衰執政。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun substituted for Zhao Shuai in governing.

sentences.zh: 七年八月，襄公卒。

translations.literal: In the seventh year, eighth month, Xiang Gong died.

sentences.zh: 太子夷皋少。

translations.literal: The crown prince Yi Gao was young.

sentences.zh: 晉人以難故，欲立長君。

translations.literal: The Jin people, because of the difficulty, desired to establish an elder lord.

sentences.zh: 趙盾曰：「立襄公弟雍。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun said: 'Establish Xiang Gong younger brother Yong.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Dun said: 'Establish Xiang Gong's younger brother Yong.

sentences.zh: 好善而長，先君愛之；

translations.literal: Good virtue and elder, former lord loved him;
translations.idiomatic: He is good and virtuous, and elder. The former lord loved him;

sentences.zh: 且近於秦，秦故好也。

translations.literal: Moreover he is close to Qin, with whom we have an old friendship.

sentences.zh: 立善則固，事長則順，奉愛則孝，結舊好則安。」

translations.literal: Establish good then solid, serve elder then orderly, honor love then filial, tie old friendship then peaceful.'
translations.idiomatic: Establishing the good is solid. Serving the elder is orderly. Honoring love is filial. Tying old friendships is peaceful.'

sentences.zh: 賈季曰：「不如其弟樂。

translations.literal: Jia Ji said: 'Not as good as his younger brother Le.

sentences.zh: 辰嬴嬖於二君，立其子，民必安之。」

translations.literal: Chen Ying favored by two lords, establish his son, people must settle with him.'
translations.idiomatic: Chen Ying was favored by two lords. Establishing his son, the people must settle with him.'

sentences.zh: 趙盾曰：「辰嬴賤，班在九人下，其子何震之有！

translations.literal: Zhao Dun said: 'Chen Ying base, position below nine people, his son what awe has!
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Dun said: 'Chen Ying is base, ranked below the nine men. What awe does his son have!

sentences.zh: 且為二君嬖，淫也。

translations.literal: Moreover, favored by two lords is licentious.

sentences.zh: 為先君子，不能求大而出在小國，僻也。

translations.literal: For former lord's son, cannot seek great and went out to small country, eccentric.
translations.idiomatic: For the former lord's son, he could not seek greatness and went out to a small country. That is eccentric.

sentences.zh: 母淫子僻，無威；

translations.literal: Mother licentious son eccentric, no authority;
translations.idiomatic: Mother licentious, son eccentric, no authority;

sentences.zh: 陳小而遠，無援：將何可乎！」

translations.literal: Chen small and distant, no support: what can be done!'
translations.idiomatic: Chen is small and distant, with no support. What can be done!'

sentences.zh: 使士會如秦迎公子雍。

translations.literal: They sent Shi Hui to Qin to welcome Prince Yong.

sentences.zh: 賈季亦使人召公子樂於陳。

translations.literal: Jia Ji also sent people to summon Prince Le from Chen.

sentences.zh: 趙盾廢賈季，以其殺陽處父。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun dismissed Jia Ji because he had killed Yang Chu Fu.

sentences.zh: 十月，葬襄公。

translations.literal: In the tenth month, they buried Xiang Gong.

sentences.zh: 十一月，賈季奔翟。

translations.literal: In the eleventh month, Jia Ji fled to Di.

sentences.zh: 是歲，秦繆公亦卒。

translations.literal: That same year, Qin Mu Gong also died.

sentences.zh: 靈公元年四月，秦康公曰：「昔文公之入也無衛，故有呂、郤之患。」

translations.literal: Ling Gong first year fourth month, Qin Kang Gong said: 'Formerly Wen Gong's entry had no guard, therefore had Lu, Xi troubles.'
translations.idiomatic: In Ling Gong's first year, fourth month, Qin Kang Gong said: 'Formerly when Wen Gong entered, there was no guard, therefore there were Lu and Xi troubles.'

sentences.zh: 乃多與公子雍衛。

translations.literal: They then greatly provided Prince Yong with guards.

sentences.zh: 太子母繆嬴日夜抱太子以號泣於朝，曰：「先君何罪？

translations.literal: Crown prince mother Mu Ying day night embraced crown prince to wail weep at court, said: 'Former lord what crime?
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince's mother Mu Ying, day and night, embraced the crown prince and wailed weeping at court, saying: 'What crime did the former lord commit?

sentences.zh: 其嗣亦何罪？

translations.literal: His successor also what crime?
translations.idiomatic: What crime did his successor also commit?

sentences.zh: 舍適而外求君，將安置此？」

translations.literal: Abandon proper and outside seek lord, will place this where?'
translations.idiomatic: Abandon the proper heir and seek a lord from outside. Where will you place this child?'

sentences.zh: 出朝，則抱以適趙盾所，頓首曰：「先君奉此子而屬之子，曰『此子材，吾受其賜；

translations.literal: Left court, then embraced to go to Zhao Dun place, knocked head said: 'Former lord presented this son and entrusted to you, said "this son talented, I receive his favor;
translations.idiomatic: Leaving court, she then embraced him and went to Zhao Dun's place, knocked her head and said: 'The former lord presented this son and entrusted him to you, saying "this son is talented, I receive his favor;

sentences.zh: 不材，吾怨子』。

translations.literal: Not talented, I resent you".'

sentences.zh: 今君卒，言猶在耳，而棄之，若何？」

translations.literal: Now lord died, words still in ear, but abandon him, how?'
translations.idiomatic: Now the lord has died, the words are still in our ears, yet you abandon him. How is this?'

sentences.zh: 趙盾與諸大夫皆患繆嬴，且畏誅，乃背所迎而立太子夷皋，是為靈公。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun and the various grandees were all troubled by Mu Ying, and moreover feared execution, so they turned back from what they had welcomed and established the crown prince Yi Gao. This was Ling Gong.

sentences.zh: 發兵以距秦送公子雍者。

translations.literal: They dispatched troops to resist those Qin was sending with Prince Yong.

sentences.zh: 趙盾為將，往擊秦，敗之令狐。

translations.literal: Zhao Dun acted as general and went to attack Qin, defeating them at Ling Hu.

sentences.zh: 先蔑、隨會亡奔秦。

translations.literal: Xian Mie and Sui Hui fled and went to Qin.

sentences.zh: 秋，齊、宋、衛、鄭、曹、許君皆會趙盾，盟於扈，以靈公初立故也。

translations.literal: In autumn, the lords of Qi, Song, Wei, Zheng, Cao, and Xu all met with Zhao Dun and allied at Hu, because Ling Gong had newly been established.

sentences.zh: 四年，伐秦，取少梁。

translations.literal: In the fourth year, they attacked Qin and took Shao Liang.

sentences.zh: 秦亦取晉之郩。

translations.literal: Qin also took Jin's Xiao.

sentences.zh: 六年，秦康公伐晉，取羈馬。

translations.literal: In the sixth year, Qin Kang Gong attacked Jin and took Ji Ma.

sentences.zh: 晉侯怒，使趙盾、趙穿、郤缺擊秦，大戰河曲，趙穿最有功。

translations.literal: The Jin lord was angered and sent Zhao Dun, Zhao Chuan, and Xi Que to attack Qin. They fought a great battle at He Qu, with Zhao Chuan having the most merit.

sentences.zh: 七年，晉六卿患隨會之在秦，常為晉亂，乃詳令魏壽餘反晉降秦。

translations.literal: Seventh year, Jin six ministers troubled Sui Hui's being in Qin, often caused Jin disorder, then falsely ordered Wei Shou Yu rebel Jin surrender Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, the Jin Six Ministers were troubled that Sui Hui was in Qin and often caused disorder for Jin, so they falsely ordered Wei Shou Yu to rebel against Jin and surrender to Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦使隨會之魏，因執會以歸晉。

translations.literal: Qin sent Sui Hui to Wei, then seized Hui and returned him to Jin.

sentences.zh: 八年，周頃王崩，公卿爭權，故不赴。

translations.literal: In the eighth year, Zhou Qing Wang died. The dukes and ministers contended for power, so they did not attend.

sentences.zh: 晉使趙盾以車八百乘平周亂而立匡王。

translations.literal: Jin sent Zhao Dun with eight hundred chariots to pacify Zhou's disorder and establish Kuang Wang.

sentences.zh: 是年，楚莊王初即位。

translations.literal: That year, Chu Zhuang Wang first ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 十二年，齊人弒其君懿公。

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, the Qi people assassinated their lord Yi Gong.

sentences.zh: 十四年，靈公壯，侈，厚斂以彫墻。

translations.literal: In the fourteenth year, Ling Gong had grown up and became extravagant, imposing heavy taxes to carve walls.

sentences.zh: 從臺上彈人，觀其避丸也。

translations.literal: From the tower he shot at people, observing them avoid the pellets.

sentences.zh: 宰夫胹熊蹯不熟，靈公怒，殺宰夫，使婦人持其尸出棄之，過朝。

translations.literal: The chef stewed bear paws but they were not cooked. Ling Gong was angered, killed the chef, and had women carry his corpse out and discard it, passing through the court.

sentences.zh: 趙盾、隨會前數諫，不聽；

translations.literal: Zhao Dun, Sui Hui previously repeatedly admonished, not listened;
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Dun and Sui Hui had previously repeatedly admonished him, but he did not listen;

sentences.zh: 已又見死人手，二人前諫。

translations.literal: Already he had again seen a dead person's hand, and the two men admonished him from the front.

sentences.zh: 隨會先諫，不聽。

translations.literal: Sui Hui had previously admonished him, but he did not listen.

sentences.zh: 靈公患之，使鉏麑刺趙盾。

translations.literal: Ling Gong was troubled by it and sent Chu Ni to assassinate Zhao Dun.

sentences.zh: 盾閨門開，居處節，鉏麑退，嘆曰：「殺忠臣，棄君命，罪一也。」

translations.literal: Dun chamber door open, dwelling moderate, Chu Ni retreated, sighed said: 'Kill loyal minister, abandon lord command, crime same.'
translations.idiomatic: Dun's chamber door was open, his dwelling was moderate. Chu Ni retreated and sighed, saying: 'Killing a loyal minister, abandoning the lord's command - it is the same crime.'

sentences.zh: 遂觸樹而死。

translations.literal: He then crashed into a tree and died.

sentences.zh: 初，盾常田首山，見桑下有餓人。

translations.literal: Initially, Dun often hunted at Shou Mountain and saw a starving person under the mulberry tree.

sentences.zh: 餓人，示瞇明也。

translations.literal: The starving person was Shi Mi Ming.

sentences.zh: 盾與之食，食其半。

translations.literal: Dun gave him food, and he ate half of it.

sentences.zh: 問其故，曰：「宦三年，未知母之存不，願遺母。」

translations.literal: Asked its reason, said: 'Served three years, unknown mother's survival not, wish send to mother.'
translations.idiomatic: Asked the reason, he said: 'I have served for three years, do not know if my mother is alive or not. I wish to send this to my mother.'

sentences.zh: 盾義之，益與之飯肉。

translations.literal: Dun regarded it as righteous and gave him even more cooked rice and meat.

sentences.zh: 已而為晉宰夫，趙盾弗復知也。

translations.literal: Later he became Jin's chef, and Zhao Dun did not recognize him again.

sentences.zh: 九月，晉靈公飲趙盾酒，伏甲將攻盾。

translations.literal: In the ninth month, Jin Ling Gong drank wine with Zhao Dun, but had hidden armored troops who would attack Dun.

sentences.zh: 公宰示瞇明知之，恐盾醉不能起，而進曰：「君賜臣，觴三行可以罷。」

translations.literal: Duke chef Shi Mi Ming knew it, feared Dun drunk could not rise, then advanced said: 'Lord grants minister, three rounds of cups can cease.'
translations.idiomatic: The duke's chef Shi Mi Ming knew of it. He feared that if Dun got drunk he could not rise, so he advanced and said: 'The lord grants the minister. Three rounds of cups can cease.'

sentences.zh: 欲以去趙盾，令先，毋及難。

translations.literal: He desired to remove Zhao Dun and ordered him to leave first, so as not to reach the difficulty.

sentences.zh: 盾既去，靈公伏士未會，先縱齧狗名敖。

translations.literal: Dun had already gone. Ling Gong's hidden soldiers were not yet assembled, so he first released a biting dog named Ao.

sentences.zh: 明為盾搏殺狗。

translations.literal: Ming wrestled and killed the dog for Dun.

sentences.zh: 盾曰：「棄人用狗，雖猛何為。」

translations.literal: Dun said: 'Abandon people use dog, though fierce what for.'
translations.idiomatic: Dun said: 'Abandoning people and using dogs - though fierce, what is it for?'

sentences.zh: 然不知明之為陰德也。
